story:
About My Work 

A doula is a labor support companion who provides continuous physical, emotional and informational support to the mother before, during and just after childbirth. I have been working as a birth doula for the past six years and I now want to expand my business to include photography. I am passionate about helping women birth confidently and without fear. As a doula I have witnessed the strength and ferocity of women laboring to become mothers, I have seen the awe on a new father’s face as he watches the woman he loves bring their child into this world, and I have seen the recognition in a newborn’s eyes as he hears his mother’s voice for the first time out of her womb. The privilege of being witness to so many births is a gift that I am grateful for everyday. I want to document these remarkable moments through photography. Visit my blog to learn more about my work as a doula. 

The Business Idea

I want to specialize in maternity, birth, and newborn photography. I will be able to incorporate this new venture into my existing doula work. I have an established network of birth professionals through which I can build a thriving photography business. I just need your help!

The Money

The funds I am asking for will be used to upgrade my photography equipment and photo-editing technology, and to purchase props for photo shoots. Most of the photos you will see on my blog were taken with a simple point and shoot camera. I will also develop marketing materials and build a professional website to display my portfolio.

On a personal note: Building my own business will enable me to stay at home more with my son. I used his birth photo as the cover image because it is one of the most beautiful moments of my life. I so happy that my friend, Melissa Kilner, was there to take that photo for me. I will cherish it forever. This is what I want to be able to do for families. Thank you for considering funding my business!

story:
I'm raising money for a camera, photography classes, and editing software



As many of you know, I've really gotten into photography. Like a lot. It started last winter when I was taking photos of bathrooms around town (that's another story). As I visited all the restaurants and public places near me, I had to start venturing further and further out to find new locales. And once the weather improved, I found myself spending hours and hours walking around the city, taking photos with my iPhone. 

It's no secret that I'm not from Boston. I've lived here though for seven years, and it's only since I started walking around my adopted city that I really began to appreciate it. Which is why I try to go exploring every chance I get. Taking pictures gives me motivation to get out there. 


My passion in photography really blew up when a friend let me borrow her digital camera (Thanks, Molly!). With a DSLR, I was able to take photos and interact with people in a way that I was never able to with my iPhone. 


What I am asking for:

I work two jobs in the course of six days a week. I'm not complaining. I seriously love what I do. But I also love photography and I'd like to see where it takes me. I'm asking for help to:

  • Purchase a new Digital SLR (I've read all the reviews and I have my eye on a Nikon D5300) The camera with an 18-55mm lens, extra battery, and storage card is $750.
  • Take online courses and in-person workshops on photography. These courses are $10/month.
  • Purchase photo editing software that helps me get to the next level. The cost of the software is $19.99/month.
My priority is the camera, first and foremost. I can certainly make due without the classes and software for the time being. But I would like to sell my photos and eventually do private photo shoots, so all the extra help will go a long way.


My friends and family have been amazingly supportive of my photography. Of me, really. Which is why I'm hoping you don't mind me asking for support in another way. Any help is appreciated--whether it's financially here on Indiegogo, or it's joining me for a walk around town, or liking/commenting on one of my photos. Thank you.

story:
About My Story

Hi, My name is Raffaele Ferrari a Photographer and Visual Artist and i'm raising funds to publish my first photographic book  about India, a  story that I have been working  for the past 10 years.

My journey through India took me from chaotic metropolitan landscapes to the majestic Himalayas, from the long beaches of Karnataka to the sacred river of the Ganges. It was a clash of cultures between the hustle and bustle of metropolitan city life and the most conservative communities of the peripheral regions. It is a millennial charm so difficult to tell in words that I tried to translate that experience into essential images.

Print A-Woman dry a sari, Gokarna, 2018

And today, more than ever, it makes sense to propose them for the rapid change that those places are having and which, in some cases, completely transformed, often losing that harmony between nature and culture which was such a typically Indian trait.

The end result is a series of images presented in this book in which I try to manage and match portraits, street photography and landscapes together as a cohesive story about my vision of India. A land of languid warmth, endless and magnificent landscapes, intriguing people and many different languages, religions and cultures.

Print B- Dal Lake, Srinagar, Kashmir, 2013

Print C -  Pushkar, Rajasthan 2018

Why so Long?

Because I wanted to take all the necessary time to express in images the emotions and character to travel deeper into the culture and immerse myself with the people. It was only after returning again and again, spending the time to observe, learn and understand better that could I take the photos for tell this genuine story. Over the years this becoming a personal project and the main goal has become to create a timeless body of work about this incredible country.

Tso Moriri Lake, Ladakh 2013

Follow me—and this Project on Social Media (click links below):

Instagram (@rafaele80): https://www.instagram.com/rafaele80/

Please visit raffaeleferrari.com to stay up-to-date on new work!

Twitter(@NomadeinAsia):https://twitter.com/NomadeinAsia

What Your Pledge will Help Fund.

10 trips to India. 

11 years of camera maintenance & repair.

2 royal enfield and many hours and hours in the mechanic shop.

1000 rolls of film and lab processing.

20 liters of chai and 10 liters of black coffee.

400+ hours of editing and re-editing and then editing again.

300˜ negative drum scans.

Some  boxes of print paper and  CMYK ink cartridges.

AND THEN.. The printer, the videomaker, the writer, the designer, the editor, my photo assistants 

Self-funding this book project in it’s entirety was not cheap, but it was the only way to not compromise on any detail and to have full control of every step of the creative process.

THANK YOU for your interest and support.

Road to Leh, Ladakh 2013

About the Book:

Book details:

220mm X220 mm

Hardcover

48 photos , 80 pages 

300 copies

Edition of 300

Risks & Challenges

Nearly all of the challenges of creating this book are behind me as I have already self-funded the project in it’s entirety and  the books are 100% completed and waiting to decorate your coffee tables.

We will be packing and sending all of the rewards out shortly after this campaign ends. The only risk or challenge is that the book doesn’t sell and my photo studio becomes a warehouse…!

THANK YOU!

story:
The Down-low

Ahoy!  My name is Jeff Kornelis, and I'm a photographer.  My special lady friend Molly and I are taking a trip to Iceland, the length of which depends on our budget.  This is my attempt at earning my airfare and lengthening our trip via my passion for photography.  I have 16 prints of various sizes and formats, and for each donation of a designated value I will give you a choice of photo(s) mixed and/or matched to your level of donation.  I will ship within the continental US, or deliver within Whatcom County.  

  • If I meet my goal I'll have my travel cost taken care of
  • If anyone is especially interested in my work I'll consider printing from my portfolio
  • Any donation will add time for me to explore and photograph an amazing, beautiful place

This is somewhat of a short duration fundraiser (four weeks) so please spread the word, especially to local art enthusiasts.  

What I Need & What You Get

There are 6 levels of donation for prints of various quality (get 'em before they're gone):

-$15 donation level (8"x10")  NOW $7.50!

-$30 donation level  (5"x7" hand printed in the dark room by yours truly) NOW $15!

-$50 donation level (canvas prints)  NOW $25 EACH!!

-NO LONGER AVAILABLE  (Bought With $100 donation)

-$100 donation level (large prints framed by Fourth Corner Frames)  NOW $50!!

-$125 donation level (My personal favorite framed at Fourth Corner Frames)  NOW $62.50!!

So there you have it.  My printed photos for your generous and helpful donations.  And if you're not into art, but would like to help, you can always donate anonymously.  Thanks for looking, and be sure to let me know if you'd like to see my portfolio for possible printing of photos you don't see here.

story:
I want to send 500 disposable cameras to 500 different people in different parts of the world. I want to document noon across the globe

The 12:00 Noon Project is a global photography project aimed at opening the public's eyes as to what life is like across the globe. My goal is to put at least 500 disposable cameras in the hands of children and teenagers across the globe. At twelve o clock every day they will be asked to take one picture using the disposable camera, capturing what it is like in the environment they live in. When they are done with the camera, they will send it back to me for developing. I will sort through the thousands of photos to select the most breathtaking images that capture 12:00 across the globe. My goal is to open people's eyes and let them see that the world around them is far from the only world around.

Risks and challenges

It will be challenging to find 500 people to send the cameras to, as well as get all the film back and develop it, but if all goes well, this will be a remarkable way to capture what the world looks like through so many people's eyes.

FAQ

I want to be a part of the project, how can I get involved?

It's easy! Just pledge a minimum of $10 and select the reward "A disposable camera so you can partake in the project!" Message me with your mailing address and once the project hits $500, I will be sending out the first batch of cameras. The second batch will be sent went the rest of the funding is finished. If all of the disposable camera rewards are taken, please message me to see if there is still room for more participants in the project. Thanks!

What do you plan on doing with the photos?

Simple question. Complex answer. The result of the project will totally depend on what I receive back from the participants in the project. Originally this was going to be a strictly analog project, but I have now allowed people with digital cameras to participate which creates a new dynamic to the project. There will most definitely be a photo book made from the best photos from the project, as well as a paperback book outlining the project. I am also hoping to put together a short documentary if I can gather enough material. It all depends on what I wind up with in the end!

Why disposable cameras?

Many people have asked why I have chosen to use disposable cameras instead of going with digital images. I have many answers for this, but my answer has also changed since the project starter. In the beginning of the project I really wanted to be able to get cameras to people who would never have the opportunity to probably ever take a picture. I also wanted the opportunity to receive the negatives from the cameras so I could do some post production after I received the cameras back. This is why I originally decided to go with disposable cameras, I thought it was more personal. Since the project started however I have gotten requests from people who would like to participate in the project but they would like to use a digital camera. I have no objections to that, however my primary focus is on the disposable cameras.

What are your costs and expenditures for this project?

Well, I have calculated that if I buy the cameras all at one time (pending successful funding completion) I can 200 cameras for around $550. The cost of shipping will vary depending on where I need to ship the camera to, and then I need to pay for the return shipping. I have estimated about a $15 cost for each person in edition to the $550 for the 200 cameras. If the project gets funded, I will start with 200 participants at an estimated cost break of $3550. That cost only covers the shipment and purchase of the cameras. It doesn't take into consideration the post-production and editing that will go on after the I receive the cameras from the participants. This project is an expensive project and that is why I am so grateful Kickstarter has backed me in helping me get this project out there in the world.

What are your costs and expenditures for this project?

story:
→→→ 日本語はこちらへ ←←←

•••••

What does it mean to be hāfu, or half Japanese, and how does this influence who we are? 

•••••

Growing up in a Japanese / Belgian mixed family, I have called myself hāfu ever since I can remember. My multicultural upbringing surely had advantages, but I also remember disliking it and wanting to be ‘just Belgian’ or 'more Japanese'. Last year, right after the birth of my daughter Yuna, I decided to compare my experiences with other hāfu.

This resulted in Hāfu2Hāfu; a photographic project in which I investigate what it means to be hāfu. By portraying and interviewing other hāfu and by sharing their unique question to you – the viewer – we create a dialogue about identity and stimulate self-reflection. I hope the combination of portraits and questions will result in more acceptance and mutual understanding between Japanese hāfu, their (non) Japanese family, friends, colleagues or classmates.

“I used some questions from the project to discuss childhood issues caused by cultural differences between my parents with them.” – Anonymous hāfu

What started as a small personal project, has become larger than I could have imagined: Hāfu2Hāfu is constantly growing and reaching more and more people. With 90 photos and questions from hāfu from 65 different 'other' countries, it represents and connects a community of people with one Japanese parent throughout the world. The project has also been picked up by international media and I have been asked to give presentations and workshops.  

•••••

With your help I hope to cover more countries and bundle these portraits and questions in a beautiful book.

•••••

 

••• ​What is hāfu •••

Hāfu/haafu is the Japanese word used for somebody with a mixed background. It comes from the English word ‘half’, referring to the half foreign and half Japanese-ness. Although it is the most frequently used label for self-introduction by hāfu in Japan, it is important to note that some find it discriminatory. The use of labels is an important part of the discussion in this project.

••• The process •••

“A portrait is not made in the camera, but on either side of it” – Edward Steichen

Before photographing participating hāfu, we have a very open personal conversation in which many aspects of being hāfu are discussed: what are the advantages and disadvantages, where do we belong and where do we want to belong? At the end of the interview, before taking the portrait, the interviewed hāfu formulates the ultimate question he or she wants to ask other hāfu. Hence the name of the project: Hāfu2Hāfu.


Photo by Victoria Vlisides

 

••• Diversity in Hāfu •••

Meeting hāfu with different combinations of nationalities with Japanese is important because 'the other nationality' is probably the most important factor in how we all experience our hāfu-ness. The ultimate goal is to have at least one photo and question from every nationality, mixed with Japan. There are 193 recognised countries (UN), so there are 192 possible combinations of countries, mixed with Japan.

On top of the variation of nationalities, I try to cover diversity in other aspects that influence hāfu-identity such as: place of birth and upbringing, age, gender, the parent’s marital status, religion, siblings, the knowledge of Japanese or other languages and sexual preference. I have now photographed and interviewed more than 90 hāfu from over 65 'other' countries from every continent, with different profiles. 

 

••• Website •••

Hāfu2Hāfu.org is where you can see all the portraits and where viewers can react to the questions asked by the participating hāfu. Other hāfu, their families, friends and people without mixed heritage can share their experiences with others. Today, the website counts more than 500 reactions from all over the world. 

 

••• Pre-order The Book •••

Wouldn't it be wonderful if we could bundle all these portraits and questions in a beautifully crafted photo book? I believe this is a logical next step for the project and hope to make this happen with your help. 

The book will hold portraits and questions from at least 120 hāfu from different countries or with different profiles. The final number will depend on the funding we manage to raise here. 

The book will be produced and shipped by mid 2019, after completion of the project. The definitive format and finishing will be determined in a later stage.

These are mockups of the book. The final version will look differently.

 

••• Pre-Order A Special Limited Edition Book •••

  • Each Special Limited Edition Book will have a unique high quality photo inlaid on the cover;
  • The number of Special Edition Books will be equal to the number of photos in the book;
  • Your book will be signed, numbered and will include a hand written thank you note.

••• Order Prints •••

Display your favourite portrait or a series of photos from the Hāfu2Hāfu project and amaze your friends with this beautiful conversation starter. You can select photographs from the current selection immediately, or wait and order your prints later when there are more photos to choose from.

  • 30 x 20 cm (12 x 8 inches);
  • Black and white;
  • Printed on high quality Fujifilm Original Photopaper;
  • Question to you and basic information printed on separate card.

 

••• Why € 30.000? •••

For this campaign I have set a minimum amount of € 30.000. This is the amount I need to produce and deliver a beautifully crafted book with approximately 120 images and questions of hāfu from different countries with various backgrounds. 

But I aim at raising more funds, so that we can make a bigger book with even more images than that!

  • For € 50.000 I will be able to make a book with approximately 150 images of hāfu from various backgrounds;
  • For € 70.000 I will be able to make a book with approximately 180 images of hāfu from various backgrounds.

More support = more countries + more photos + more questions in the book

Why showing your support at this stage matters:

  • By pre-ordering your book or prints now, you actively contribute to making more photographs and collecting more questions;
  • The number of photos in the book will depend on the total amount we manage to raise with this campaign; 

  • As a backer, you can choose to be mentioned and thanked for you contribution in the book;

  • It is important to mention that as a backer, your risk is limited: you will be refunded if we do not raise the minimum amount needed for the production of a beautiful book.  

The money raised from this campaign will be used for:

  • Research, production, project management, communication, PR;
  • Photography, interviews, editing;
  • Travel expenses;
  • Community management (website and social media);
  • Website updates, hosting and maintenance;
  • Coffee for me and the interviewee;
  • Translations;
  • Book production and production of other rewards (perks);
  • Indiegogo fee;
  • Promotional materials.

 

••• Other Ways to Support this Project •••

Do you want to do more to support this project achieve its ambitious goal to capture one Japanese hāfu from every country in the world? Here's what you can do:

  • Share this page with your family and friends!
  • Like and follow us on Facebook and Instagram and invite your friends to do the same.
  • Ask your hāfu friends from countries not covered yet, if they'd like to participate. Please look here for an updated list of countries covered.
  • Share this project with your media connections and ask them to cover it. 

 

••• Press coverage •••

  • Hāfu2Hāfu has been covered by some influential national and international media, including: 

    • the New York Times: "If you gaze at the many portraits of half-Japanese, you can see the searching in their faces, the puzzling out. But you can also gain the sense that there are deep currents, forces old and powerful, in opposition to wall-building and racial hunkering." - 11 March 2017
    • Japan Today: "Interviews often elicit mixes of joy, pain and the mutual laughter of two people relating. Yet, an online viewer gets just a glimpse of these sessions." (read interview here) - 25 Oct 2017
    • the Japan Times: "“Both those raised abroad and those raised in Japan want to ‘belong’ to Japan more than most of them do. But this is more ‘painful’ when one is living in Japan." (read interview here) - 8 Oct 2017

     

    ••• Presentations •••

    In June 2017, I was invited to present Hāfu2Hāfu at Pecha Kucha Tokyo. Pecha Kucha is an international platform for creative and meaningful projects, presented according to a fixed format of 20 slides and 20 seconds per slide. You can view the presentation here. 

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

    And here's the text in Japanese

    •••••

    「ハーフ」、つまり「日本人とのハーフであること」とは一体何でしょうか。それが私たちハーフのアイデンティティにどんな風に影響しているのでしょうか。

    •••••

    ベルギー人と日本人の両親を持つ私は、物心ついたときから自分のことを「ハーフ」と呼んできました。確かに多文化的な私の生い立ちは財産になりましたが、しかし一方でそれを嫌ってもいました。私は「ただのベルギー人」、でなければ「ただの日本人」になりたかったのです。去年、娘のユナが生まれてすぐに、私は自分の経験を他のハーフの人たちと比べてみることにしました。

    これがきっかけとなり、「ハーフである」とはどういうことなのかを探る撮影企画としてハーフ2(トゥ)ハーフ・プロジェクトを立ち上げました。私が他のハーフたちと話し、ポートレート写真を撮り、彼らだからこそ発せられる問いかけをあなたに届けることで、あなたとハーフの間にアイデンティティについての対話を生み出し、自分の心の内を観察してみるきっかけを作れればと考えています。そしてそのポートレート写真と問いかけを、日本人を親に持つハーフと、彼らの家族や友人、同僚やクラスメイトとの間の橋渡しにしたいと考えています。

    あるハーフからは、「子供の頃に文化の違いが引き起こした出来事を両親と話し合うために、このプロジェクトの問いかけを使いました。」という声が寄せられています。

    個人的な企画として始まったハーフ2ハーフ・プロジェクトは、そのスタートからは想像もできないほど大きく育ち、今もより多くの人に届いています。日本と「他の」65カ国との間に生まれたハーフ90人のポートレート写真と問いかけが、世界中の、日本人を親に持つハーフやその周囲を結びつけ、一つのコミュニティが生まれています。またプロジェクトは国際メディアで取り上げられ、現在までにプレゼンテーションやワークショップの依頼を複数頂きました。

    •••••

    私はあなたのご支援を通じて、それぞれ異なる国にルーツを持つより多くのハーフに会い、彼らのポートレート写真と問いかけを一冊の写真集にまとめたいと考えています。

    •••••

     

    ••••• ハーフとは •••••

    「ハーフ」とは、国籍や人種が異なる両親を持つ人に対して使われる日本語です。英語の half （半分）からきており、半分は外国人、半分は日本人という事を示しています。日本のハーフの間では自己紹介で最もよく使われる言葉ですが、差別語と感じる人もいる事は知っておくべきでしょう。そういった言葉の使い方は、このプロジェクトの重要なテーマのひとつになっています。

     

    ••••• プロジェクトの進め方 •••••

    「ポートレート写真はカメラの中ではなく、その前と後ろの両側で製作される」　－エドワード・スタイケン

    参加してくれる方のポートレート写真を撮る前に、ハーフであることの色々な側面についてオープンかつプライベートな会話をするところから始めます。ハーフで有利なこと、不利なこと、私たちはどこに帰属しているか、どこに帰属していたいか、などなど。撮影前のこの会話を通じて、参加者の中で他のハーフへの問いかけが突き詰められていきます。Hāfu2Hāfu、「ハーフからハーフに」というこのプロジェクト名の由来はここにあります。

    写真撮影：Victoria Vlisides

     

    ••••• ハーフの多様性 •••••

    色々な国籍と日本人の組合せによる様々なハーフの方と会い、話をする事が重要です。ハーフとしてどのような体験をしてきたのかは、どの国とのハーフかによって恐らく最も大きく左右されるからです。そのため日本人と他の全ての国籍の組合せを網羅し、少なくともそれぞれ１枚のポートレート写真と問いかけを収録することを最終ゴールとしています。国連加盟国は193ヶ国あるため、日本人との組み合わせは192通りあることになります。

    国籍の他にも、ハーフとしてのアイデンティティーに影響を与える他の多様性もカバーしたいと思います。例えば出生地や教育、年齢、性別、両親の婚姻状態、宗教、きょうだい、日本語やその他言語の語学力、性的嗜好等です。現在までに、全ての大陸の65ヶ国以上との組合せで、90人以上の多種多様なハーフと会って話し、ポートレート写真を撮影してきました。

     

    ••••• プロジェクトウェブサイト •••••

    Hāfu2Hāfu.org　では全てのポートレート写真をご覧いただけるとともに、プロジェクトに参加したハーフの問いかけに対して、閲覧者から回答する事もできます。参加していないハーフの方々、その家族や友人、ハーフでない方も、自分の経験をサイト上で共有頂けます。現在までに、世界中から500以上の反響を頂いています。

     

    ••••• 写真集の事前注文について •••••

    全てのポートレート写真や問いかけを、美しい装丁の写真集にまとめられたらどんなに素晴らしいことでしょうか。プロジェクトの次のステップとして、皆さまのご支援を頂き実現したいと強く思っています。

    写真集には、多種多様な国籍やプロフィールを持つ少なくとも120人のハーフのポートレート写真と問いかけを収める予定です。実際に何人になるかは、今回の募金達成額にかかっています。

    写真集はこのプロジェクトの完了後、2019年半ばまでに出版、発送する予定です。最終的なフォーマットや仕上がりは、今後決めていきます。

    こちらはサンプル版です。最終版とは異なります。

     

    ••••• 特別限定版の事前注文 •••••

    • 掲載写真の１枚ずつを高画質プリントとして表紙にあしらった、特別限定版を発行します。
    • 特別限定版の出版数は、写真集に掲載されているポートレート写真の数だけとなります。
    • 限定版を示す通し番号と、手書きの感謝の言葉にサインを添えてお届けします。

    こちらはサンプル版です。最終版とは異なります。

     

    ••••• 個別ポートレート写真の注文 ••••

    Hāfu2Hāfuプロジェクトの中からお気に入りのポートレート写真を選び、飾ってみるのはいかがでしょうか。友達の目を惹きつけ、会話が弾むこと請け合いです。掲載されているポートレート写真から今すぐお好みのものを選んでいただいても結構ですし、後日ポートレート写真が増えてから選択することも可能です。

    • 30cm×20cm  (12 inch×8 inch)
    • 白黒写真
    • 富士フィルムオリジナル高品質写真用紙
    • 貴方への問いかけと説明を、別添カードにしてお届けします

     

    ••••• 目標額30,000ユーロの理由 •••••

    今回の活動に最低限必要な額として30,000ユーロを目標額にしました。これはそれぞれ異なる国にルーツを持つ、様々な生い立ちのハーフ約120人のポートレート写真と問いかけをしっかりとした写真集にまとめ、支援を頂いた皆さまにお届けするのに必要な金額です。

    しかし、私はもっとたくさんのハーフの姿を収められるように、より多くのご支援を募りたいと思います！

    • 50,000ユーロでは約150人、
    • 70,000ユーロなら約180人を収録できます。

    さらなるご支援を頂くことで、より多くの国をカバーし、より多くのポートレート写真、問いかけを写真集に収めることにつながります。

     

    ••• このタイミングでご支援頂くことが重要である理由 •••

    • 写真集や写真プリントの事前注文を今していただくことで、より多くの写真と問いかけの収集に積極的に寄与していただけます。
    • 写真集に収録するポートレート写真がいくつになるかは、今回の活動で集まるご支援の総額にかかっています。
    • 支援頂いた方は、写真集にお名前を掲載し謝意を表明させて頂くことをご選択いただけます。
    • なお、後援者の方が負うリスクは限られています。美しい写真集の制作に最低限必要な額を集められなければ、ご支援金は払い戻しさせていただきます。

    この活動で集められた資金は以下のことに充てられます：

    • 調査、制作、プロジェクト運営、コミュニケーション、PR活動
    • 撮影、インタビュー、編集
    • 交通費
    • コミュニティ運営 (ウェブサイトおよびソーシャルメディア)
    • ウェブサイト更新、サーバーレンタル、メンテナンス
    • インタビュー参加者および制作者へのコーヒー代金
    • 翻訳
    • 写真集制作および他お礼の制作 (特典)
    • Indiegogo利用料金
    • 販促物

     

    ••• このプロジェクトをご支援いただく他の方法 •••

    全世界各国の人と日本人を親に持つハーフの姿を捉える、というプロジェクトの壮大な目標達成のため、さらにご支援頂けますか？

    他にも以下のような方法があります。

    • このページを貴方の家族、友人とシェアしてください。
    • FacebookとInstagramで「いいね」とフォローをしていただき、友人にもそうするよう勧めてください。

    • メディア関係者をご存知の方は、このプロジェクトの事を伝え、取材してみてはとお勧めください。

    ••• メディア報道 •••

    ハーフ2ハーフ・プロジェクトは、以下のような国内外の有力メディアでも取り上げられています。

    ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙：「日本人を親に持つハーフたちのポートレート写真の数々を見つめていると、彼らの顔から解を探し求めているような迷いを見て取ることができる。しかし一方で、壁の建設や人種的な固執に立ち向かう、彼らに深く根差した古く強い力も感じ取れるのだ。」－2017年3月11日の記事より

    ジャパントゥデイ紙：「インタビューは関わった2人の喜びや痛み、笑いが混ざりあったものを引き出すことが度々ある。だがそれをオンラインでなぞってみたところで、その一瞬を垣間見られるだけだ。」(こちらで記事をご覧いただけます)－2017年10月25日 (こちらの記事は英語のみです）

    ジャパンタイムズ紙：「海外で育ったハーフ、日本で育ったハーフのどちらも、ほとんどは今よりもっと日本に『帰属』したいと考えている。しかし日本に住みながらその思いを抱えることは、より『痛みを伴う』ものだ。」(こちらで記事をご覧いただけます)－2017年10月8日 (こちらの記事は英語のみです)

story_txt:
→→→ 日本語はこちらへ ←←←•••••What does it mean to be hāfu, or half Japanese, and how does this influence who we are? •••••Growing up in a Japanese / Belgian mixed family, I have called myself hāfu ever since I can remember. My multicultural upbringing surely had advantages, but I also remember disliking it and wanting to be ‘just Belgian’ or 'more Japanese'. Last year, right after the birth of my daughter Yuna, I decided to compare my experiences with other hāfu.This resulted in Hāfu2Hāfu; a photographic project in which I investigate what it means to be hāfu. By portraying and interviewing other hāfu and by sharing their unique question to you – the viewer – we create a dialogue about identity and stimulate self-reflection. I hope the combination of portraits and questions will result in more acceptance and mutual understanding between Japanese hāfu, their (non) Japanese family, friends, colleagues or classmates.“I used some questions from the project to discuss childhood issues caused by cultural differences between my parents with them.” – Anonymous hāfuWhat started as a small personal project, has become larger than I could have imagined: Hāfu2Hāfu is constantly growing and reaching more and more people. With 90 photos and questions from hāfu from 65 different 'other' countries, it represents and connects a community of people with one Japanese parent throughout the world. The project has also been picked up by international media and I have been asked to give presentations and workshops.  •••••With your help I hope to cover more countries and bundle these portraits and questions in a beautiful book.•••••

 
••• ​What is hāfu •••

Hāfu/haafu is the Japanese word used for somebody with a mixed background. It comes from the English word ‘half’, referring to the half foreign and half Japanese-ness. Although it is the most frequently used label for self-introduction by hāfu in Japan, it is important to note that some find it discriminatory. The use of labels is an important part of the discussion in this project.
••• The process •••

“A portrait is not made in the camera, but on either side of it” – Edward Steichen
Before photographing participating hāfu, we have a very open personal conversation in which many aspects of being hāfu are discussed: what are the advantages and disadvantages, where do we belong and where do we want to belong? At the end of the interview, before taking the portrait, the interviewed hāfu formulates the ultimate question he or she wants to ask other hāfu. Hence the name of the project: Hāfu2Hāfu.
Photo by Victoria Vlisides

 
••• Diversity in Hāfu •••
Meeting hāfu with different combinations of nationalities with Japanese is important because 'the other nationality' is probably the most important factor in how we all experience our hāfu-ness. The ultimate goal is to have at least one photo and question from every nationality, mixed with Japan. There are 193 recognised countries (UN), so there are 192 possible combinations of countries, mixed with Japan.
On top of the variation of nationalities, I try to cover diversity in other aspects that influence hāfu-identity such as: place of birth and upbringing, age, gender, the parent’s marital status, religion, siblings, the knowledge of Japanese or other languages and sexual preference. I have now photographed and interviewed more than 90 hāfu from over 65 'other' countries from every continent, with different profiles. 
 
••• Website •••

Hāfu2Hāfu.org is where you can see all the portraits and where viewers can react to the questions asked by the participating hāfu. Other hāfu, their families, friends and people without mixed heritage can share their experiences with others. Today, the website counts more than 500 reactions from all over the world. 
 
••• Pre-order The Book •••
Wouldn't it be wonderful if we could bundle all these portraits and questions in a beautifully crafted photo book? I believe this is a logical next step for the project and hope to make this happen with your help. 
The book will hold portraits and questions from at least 120 hāfu from different countries or with different profiles. The final number will depend on the funding we manage to raise here. 
The book will be produced and shipped by mid 2019, after completion of the project. The definitive format and finishing will be determined in a later stage.


These are mockups of the book. The final version will look differently.
 
••• Pre-Order A Special Limited Edition Book •••

Each Special Limited Edition Book will have a unique high quality photo inlaid on the cover;
The number of Special Edition Books will be equal to the number of photos in the book;
Your book will be signed, numbered and will include a hand written thank you note.


••• Order Prints •••
Display your favourite portrait or a series of photos from the Hāfu2Hāfu project and amaze your friends with this beautiful conversation starter. You can select photographs from the current selection immediately, or wait and order your prints later when there are more photos to choose from.

30 x 20 cm (12 x 8 inches);
Black and white;
Printed on high quality Fujifilm Original Photopaper;
Question to you and basic information printed on separate card.



 
••• Why € 30.000? •••
For this campaign I have set a minimum amount of € 30.000. This is the amount I need to produce and deliver a beautifully crafted book with approximately 120 images and questions of hāfu from different countries with various backgrounds. 
But I aim at raising more funds, so that we can make a bigger book with even more images than that!


For € 50.000 I will be able to make a book with approximately 150 images of hāfu from various backgrounds;

For € 70.000 I will be able to make a book with approximately 180 images of hāfu from various backgrounds.

More support = more countries + more photos + more questions in the book
Why showing your support at this stage matters:

By pre-ordering your book or prints now, you actively contribute to making more photographs and collecting more questions;
The number of photos in the book will depend on the total amount we manage to raise with this campaign; 
As a backer, you can choose to be mentioned and thanked for you contribution in the book;
It is important to mention that as a backer, your risk is limited: you will be refunded if we do not raise the minimum amount needed for the production of a beautiful book.  

The money raised from this campaign will be used for:

Research, production, project management, communication, PR;
Photography, interviews, editing;
Travel expenses;
Community management (website and social media);
Website updates, hosting and maintenance;
Coffee for me and the interviewee;
Translations;
Book production and production of other rewards (perks);
Indiegogo fee;
Promotional materials.

 
••• Other Ways to Support this Project •••
Do you want to do more to support this project achieve its ambitious goal to capture one Japanese hāfu from every country in the world? Here's what you can do:

Share this page with your family and friends!
Like and follow us on Facebook and Instagram and invite your friends to do the same.
Ask your hāfu friends from countries not covered yet, if they'd like to participate. Please look here for an updated list of countries covered.

Share this project with your media connections and ask them to cover it. 

 
••• Press coverage •••


Hāfu2Hāfu has been covered by some influential national and international media, including: 


the New York Times: "If you gaze at the many portraits of half-Japanese, you can see the searching in their faces, the puzzling out. But you can also gain the sense that there are deep currents, forces old and powerful, in opposition to wall-building and racial hunkering." - 11 March 2017

Japan Today: "Interviews often elicit mixes of joy, pain and the mutual laughter of two people relating. Yet, an online viewer gets just a glimpse of these sessions." (read interview here) - 25 Oct 2017

the Japan Times: "“Both those raised abroad and those raised in Japan want to ‘belong’ to Japan more than most of them do. But this is more ‘painful’ when one is living in Japan." (read interview here) - 8 Oct 2017




 
••• Presentations •••
In June 2017, I was invited to present Hāfu2Hāfu at Pecha Kucha Tokyo. Pecha Kucha is an international platform for creative and meaningful projects, presented according to a fixed format of 20 slides and 20 seconds per slide. You can view the presentation here. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 



 And here's the text in Japanese •••••「ハーフ」、つまり「日本人とのハーフであること」とは一体何でしょうか。それが私たちハーフのアイデンティティにどんな風に影響しているのでしょうか。•••••ベルギー人と日本人の両親を持つ私は、物心ついたときから自分のことを「ハーフ」と呼んできました。確かに多文化的な私の生い立ちは財産になりましたが、しかし一方でそれを嫌ってもいました。私は「ただのベルギー人」、でなければ「ただの日本人」になりたかったのです。去年、娘のユナが生まれてすぐに、私は自分の経験を他のハーフの人たちと比べてみることにしました。これがきっかけとなり、「ハーフである」とはどういうことなのかを探る撮影企画としてハーフ2(トゥ)ハーフ・プロジェクトを立ち上げました。私が他のハーフたちと話し、ポートレート写真を撮り、彼らだからこそ発せられる問いかけをあなたに届けることで、あなたとハーフの間にアイデンティティについての対話を生み出し、自分の心の内を観察してみるきっかけを作れればと考えています。そしてそのポートレート写真と問いかけを、日本人を親に持つハーフと、彼らの家族や友人、同僚やクラスメイトとの間の橋渡しにしたいと考えています。あるハーフからは、「子供の頃に文化の違いが引き起こした出来事を両親と話し合うために、このプロジェクトの問いかけを使いました。」という声が寄せられています。個人的な企画として始まったハーフ2ハーフ・プロジェクトは、そのスタートからは想像もできないほど大きく育ち、今もより多くの人に届いています。日本と「他の」65カ国との間に生まれたハーフ90人のポートレート写真と問いかけが、世界中の、日本人を親に持つハーフやその周囲を結びつけ、一つのコミュニティが生まれています。またプロジェクトは国際メディアで取り上げられ、現在までにプレゼンテーションやワークショップの依頼を複数頂きました。•••••私はあなたのご支援を通じて、それぞれ異なる国にルーツを持つより多くのハーフに会い、彼らのポートレート写真と問いかけを一冊の写真集にまとめたいと考えています。••••• ••••• ハーフとは •••••「ハーフ」とは、国籍や人種が異なる両親を持つ人に対して使われる日本語です。英語の half （半分）からきており、半分は外国人、半分は日本人という事を示しています。日本のハーフの間では自己紹介で最もよく使われる言葉ですが、差別語と感じる人もいる事は知っておくべきでしょう。そういった言葉の使い方は、このプロジェクトの重要なテーマのひとつになっています。 ••••• プロジェクトの進め方 •••••「ポートレート写真はカメラの中ではなく、その前と後ろの両側で製作される」　－エドワード・スタイケン参加してくれる方のポートレート写真を撮る前に、ハーフであることの色々な側面についてオープンかつプライベートな会話をするところから始めます。ハーフで有利なこと、不利なこと、私たちはどこに帰属しているか、どこに帰属していたいか、などなど。撮影前のこの会話を通じて、参加者の中で他のハーフへの問いかけが突き詰められていきます。Hāfu2Hāfu、「ハーフからハーフに」というこのプロジェクト名の由来はここにあります。写真撮影：Victoria Vlisides ••••• ハーフの多様性 •••••色々な国籍と日本人の組合せによる様々なハーフの方と会い、話をする事が重要です。ハーフとしてどのような体験をしてきたのかは、どの国とのハーフかによって恐らく最も大きく左右されるからです。そのため日本人と他の全ての国籍の組合せを網羅し、少なくともそれぞれ１枚のポートレート写真と問いかけを収録することを最終ゴールとしています。国連加盟国は193ヶ国あるため、日本人との組み合わせは192通りあることになります。国籍の他にも、ハーフとしてのアイデンティティーに影響を与える他の多様性もカバーしたいと思います。例えば出生地や教育、年齢、性別、両親の婚姻状態、宗教、きょうだい、日本語やその他言語の語学力、性的嗜好等です。現在までに、全ての大陸の65ヶ国以上との組合せで、90人以上の多種多様なハーフと会って話し、ポートレート写真を撮影してきました。 ••••• プロジェクトウェブサイト •••••Hāfu2Hāfu.org　では全てのポートレート写真をご覧いただけるとともに、プロジェクトに参加したハーフの問いかけに対して、閲覧者から回答する事もできます。参加していないハーフの方々、その家族や友人、ハーフでない方も、自分の経験をサイト上で共有頂けます。現在までに、世界中から500以上の反響を頂いています。 ••••• 写真集の事前注文について •••••全てのポートレート写真や問いかけを、美しい装丁の写真集にまとめられたらどんなに素晴らしいことでしょうか。プロジェクトの次のステップとして、皆さまのご支援を頂き実現したいと強く思っています。写真集には、多種多様な国籍やプロフィールを持つ少なくとも120人のハーフのポートレート写真と問いかけを収める予定です。実際に何人になるかは、今回の募金達成額にかかっています。写真集はこのプロジェクトの完了後、2019年半ばまでに出版、発送する予定です。最終的なフォーマットや仕上がりは、今後決めていきます。こちらはサンプル版です。最終版とは異なります。 ••••• 特別限定版の事前注文 •••••
掲載写真の１枚ずつを高画質プリントとして表紙にあしらった、特別限定版を発行します。
特別限定版の出版数は、写真集に掲載されているポートレート写真の数だけとなります。
限定版を示す通し番号と、手書きの感謝の言葉にサインを添えてお届けします。
こちらはサンプル版です。最終版とは異なります。 ••••• 個別ポートレート写真の注文 ••••Hāfu2Hāfuプロジェクトの中からお気に入りのポートレート写真を選び、飾ってみるのはいかがでしょうか。友達の目を惹きつけ、会話が弾むこと請け合いです。掲載されているポートレート写真から今すぐお好みのものを選んでいただいても結構ですし、後日ポートレート写真が増えてから選択することも可能です。
30cm×20cm  (12 inch×8 inch)
白黒写真
富士フィルムオリジナル高品質写真用紙
貴方への問いかけと説明を、別添カードにしてお届けします
 
••••• 目標額30,000ユーロの理由 •••••
今回の活動に最低限必要な額として30,000ユーロを目標額にしました。これはそれぞれ異なる国にルーツを持つ、様々な生い立ちのハーフ約120人のポートレート写真と問いかけをしっかりとした写真集にまとめ、支援を頂いた皆さまにお届けするのに必要な金額です。しかし、私はもっとたくさんのハーフの姿を収められるように、より多くのご支援を募りたいと思います！
50,000ユーロでは約150人、
70,000ユーロなら約180人を収録できます。
さらなるご支援を頂くことで、より多くの国をカバーし、より多くのポートレート写真、問いかけを写真集に収めることにつながります。 ••• このタイミングでご支援頂くことが重要である理由 •••
写真集や写真プリントの事前注文を今していただくことで、より多くの写真と問いかけの収集に積極的に寄与していただけます。
写真集に収録するポートレート写真がいくつになるかは、今回の活動で集まるご支援の総額にかかっています。
支援頂いた方は、写真集にお名前を掲載し謝意を表明させて頂くことをご選択いただけます。
なお、後援者の方が負うリスクは限られています。美しい写真集の制作に最低限必要な額を集められなければ、ご支援金は払い戻しさせていただきます。
この活動で集められた資金は以下のことに充てられます：
調査、制作、プロジェクト運営、コミュニケーション、PR活動
撮影、インタビュー、編集
交通費
コミュニティ運営 (ウェブサイトおよびソーシャルメディア)
ウェブサイト更新、サーバーレンタル、メンテナンス
インタビュー参加者および制作者へのコーヒー代金
翻訳
写真集制作および他お礼の制作 (特典)
Indiegogo利用料金
販促物
 ••• このプロジェクトをご支援いただく他の方法 •••全世界各国の人と日本人を親に持つハーフの姿を捉える、というプロジェクトの壮大な目標達成のため、さらにご支援頂けますか？他にも以下のような方法があります。
このページを貴方の家族、友人とシェアしてください。

FacebookとInstagramで「いいね」とフォローをしていただき、友人にもそうするよう勧めてください。
まだカバーされていない国のハーフの友人で、プロジェクトに参加したい方がいればお誘いください。カバーされている国の最新版リストはこちらで御覧ください。

メディア関係者をご存知の方は、このプロジェクトの事を伝え、取材してみてはとお勧めください。
••• メディア報道 •••ハーフ2ハーフ・プロジェクトは、以下のような国内外の有力メディアでも取り上げられています。ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙：「日本人を親に持つハーフたちのポートレート写真の数々を見つめていると、彼らの顔から解を探し求めているような迷いを見て取ることができる。しかし一方で、壁の建設や人種的な固執に立ち向かう、彼らに深く根差した古く強い力も感じ取れるのだ。」－2017年3月11日の記事よりジャパントゥデイ紙：「インタビューは関わった2人の喜びや痛み、笑いが混ざりあったものを引き出すことが度々ある。だがそれをオンラインでなぞってみたところで、その一瞬を垣間見られるだけだ。」(こちらで記事をご覧いただけます)－2017年10月25日 (こちらの記事は英語のみです）ジャパンタイムズ紙：「海外で育ったハーフ、日本で育ったハーフのどちらも、ほとんどは今よりもっと日本に『帰属』したいと考えている。しかし日本に住みながらその思いを抱えることは、より『痛みを伴う』ものだ。」(こちらで記事をご覧いただけます)－2017年10月8日 (こちらの記事は英語のみです) ••• 特典を選ぶ ••1.　おすすめ：　写真集（支援パッケージ）€50　（送料別）　　感謝の言葉を手書きで添えた写真集をお届けするほか、支援者一覧のページに貴方のお名前を掲載します。＊写真集画像はサンプルです。特典内容

story:
FERRET UPDATE 3 August: Thanks to everyone who has supported us with The Ferret so far – the curious, the creative and the compassionate. Your tremendous backing for the vision of democratic journalism that we’ve laid out, and for the headline-grabbing stories we’ve published so far, means that we’re off to a great start.

Having reached far past our original crowdfunding target, and with less than a week to go until the crowdfund closes on 9 August, we are currently looking into fracking in Scotland. However, with additional money raised we plan to look into the hardships and injustices faced by people who seek refuge in Scotland and the wider UK – so we are now aiming for £7,600 – double our original target.


This would allow us to do a full investigation package on this topic, with a similar budget to our fracking package. All money spent will be made fully transparent to the public.

If you’d like to support our campaign in its last week financially we’d be most grateful. We’d also really appreciate it if you could help spread the word on social media – if you don’t like making up your own tweets/posts we could suggest something like “LAST CHANCE: Support@FerretScot to investigate plight of people seeking sanctuary in the UK https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-ferret-s-first-investigation-fracking/x/11158527#/story#DemocraticJournalism”

We also plan to announce a celebratory meet-up soon, where we can meet to discuss what’s been achieved so far and build the wider Ferret community – we hope that some of you will come down. We will confirm the details shortly.

Thanks and thanks again!

The Ferret Team

FERRET UPDATE:  28 July The Ferret published its first stories over the last week, after exceeding the crowdfunding target for its first investigation. Thank you! Currently, donations are over £5600, almost £2000 more than the amount we asked for to complete our first investigation, into fracking.

Our first exclusive stories have included uncovering a secret police report on the state of Scotland's CCTV system and revealing attempts by oil tycoon Algy Cluff to pressurise the Scottish government to allow undersea coal gasification, a technique SNP MP Tommy Sheppard told us was "more problematic than fracking".

There are now LESS THAN TWO WEEKS left, and with extra funds raised we can promise to investigate further areas, which could potentially include challenges faced by people seeking asylum, NHS cuts or the justice system in Scotland. 

One hundred and sixty people have already supported us (find out who some of them are) to investigate fracking after the issue topped our public vote last month, taking 37 per cent of ballots cast.

The underseas coal gasification article is not part of the fracking package we have promised backers, but a bonus story.

Billy Briggs, one of The Ferret’s founders, said: “We are extremely grateful to everyone who has backed The Ferret and delighted to have raised over £5000. The more money we raise, the more issues we can investigate. We hope people will continue to donate to our crowdfunding campaign. The team at The Ferret is excited about the future and we are working hard on your behalf to hold power to account. We are already nosing up the trousers of power.”

The launch of The Ferret prompted much media interest and led to a number of articles being published. They included reports by The Guardian, the Press Gazette, journalism.co.uk, the Global Investigative Journalism Network, Through The Cracks and the Pakistan Telegraph, as well as much social media interest.

The Ferret’s Peter Geoghegan was interviewed by BBC Radio Scotland’s Good Morning Scotland and STV’s Scotland Tonight, and Rob Edwards has been on BBC Good Morning Scotland to talk about the Ferret's first stories.

Please stay tuned, help spread the word and we look forward to ferreting hard on your behalf.

We need your help to investigate the stories that matter - like fracking.

Investigative journalism is suffering in Scotland. The advertising revenues that have traditionally funded journalists to uncover scandals are being swept away in the whirlwind of the Internet revolution. We believe that something must be done. In a democracy like ours, few things are more important than a free, fair and independent media, holding the powerful to account. Without serious, fact-based journalism in pursuit of the public interest and beholden to no-one, Scotland would be a darker place.

Why The Ferret?

That is why a group of highly experienced journalists have founded The Ferret, Scotland’s first investigative journalism platform. The Ferret will not be owned by some distant corporation: it will be owned by its members and run as a not-for-profit cooperative. The Ferret will not be aligned with any political party or any vested interest. The Ferret will be both challenging and irreverent, taking its stories seriously without taking itself too seriously. We want to nose up the trousers of power, on your behalf.

Who’s involved?

The team at The Ferret comprises of journalists Billy Briggs, Rob Edwards, Peter Geoghegan, and Rachel Hamada, as well as designer Jo Skinner. (Find out more about the Ferret team. Samples of some of our recent stories are on our front page.) We also have some great supporters, such as photographers Simon Murphy and Angela Catlin; journalists Mei-Ling McNamara, Tom Allan and David Eyre; James Mackenzie and Edd McCracken. 

What they're saying about us:

Irvine Welsh, Author - "Democracy thrives in the light, and part of the reason it has become so sick in the west, is that the mainstream media with its wealthy proprietors now act solely as mouthpieces for the interests of an international elite. Such people are seen as beyond reproach or investigation, while, paradoxically, the activities of ordinary citizens become more and more proscribed. A fledgling, emergent democracy like Scotland needs to develop the highest standards of investigative journalism to protect and nurture itself."

Karine Polwart, singer and songwriter - "Collectively we can't take responsibility for governing ourselves in a just and sustainable manner if we're unaware of the stories, the science, the values and vested interests that underpin what's happening in the world we inhabit. The kind of in depth independent investigative journalism that The Ferret promises has never been more essential. And it's ours to own and support together."

Iain Macwhirter, political columnist for The Herald and the Sunday Herald - "The Ferret is just what Scottish journalism needs: independent, investigative, intelligent - and up the trouser leg of the establishment."

Paul Wood , Managing Director, West Highland Publishing Company Limited - "We need more independent media asking the questions the powerful don't want to answer. We need that media to be independent and we need it to thrive. All at the West Highland Free Press wish The Ferret every success; it's vital they succeed."

Nicole Kleeman, Executive Producer, Firecrest Films - "Scotland is crying out for a dedicated outlet investigating what is really going on, without political slant or pressure to hit sales targets and viewing figures."

Please help fund our first investigation.

The Ferret will listen to and involve its readers. You have already helped us choose our first investigation, which will be into FRACKING, after it topped our recent public poll with 37 per cent of the vote.

Why is fracking important?

Well, the Scottish Government has announced a temporary moratorium on onshore gas exploitation, including fracking for underground shale gas and drilling for coalbed methane. The public are to be consulted and safety is to be studied but what does this really mean? What deals are being done behind the scenes to protect the vested interests of multinational gas companies and big landowners? What roles are key ministers playing? Why does the moratorium not cover undersea coal gasification, which may be more risky? What communities across Scotland are under threat? What are the real risks – for health, the environment and the climate? Please fund us so we can provide some answers.

What do I get?

You get to be part of an impartial and fearless new journalism project, created for the people, not for politicians or media tycoons. And, depending on the reward level you choose when you invest, you can get your hands on some extras...

How will the money be used?

Your investment will fund an investigation into fracking and cover the costs of our specialised reporting team. We will account for every penny by publishing details of all costs and payments on our website. None of our team or contributors will be paid above the average wage in Scotland for their time, but they will be paid fairly. Our draft proposed budget is:

Paying freelance journalists for their work: £1,800

Multimedia: £700

Web and administrative support: £500

Travel and expenses: £300

Indiegogo percentage: £152

Contingency: £348

TOTAL : £3,800

If the public is generous enough to support us beyond this target, you will allow us to explore other subjects, for example the challenges faced by people seeking asylum in Scotland; cuts to the NHS, which also proved popular in our public vote; or any other timely stories that need investigating.

Why a not-for-profit cooperative?

Most of the news media in the UK is owned by a handful of proprietors or corporations, often with strong political biases. The Ferret will be owned by its writers and readers, resulting in a more democratic form of ownership, with members having a say in its running. The Ferret will be accountable to you, our readers, ensuring that we always report in your interests. 

And because we are a cooperative, all profits will be reinvested into The Ferret so we can build and continue to pursue stories in the public interest.

"We want to afflict the comfortable and comfort the afflicted."
story_txt:
FERRET UPDATE 3 August: Thanks to everyone who has supported us with The Ferret so far – the curious, the creative and the compassionate. Your tremendous backing for the vision of democratic journalism that we’ve laid out, and for the headline-grabbing stories we’ve published so far, means that we’re off to a great start.Having reached far past our original crowdfunding target, and with less than a week to go until the crowdfund closes on 9 August, we are currently looking into fracking in Scotland. However, with additional money raised we plan to look into the hardships and injustices faced by people who seek refuge in Scotland and the wider UK – so we are now aiming for £7,600 – double our original target.
This would allow us to do a full investigation package on this topic, with a similar budget to our fracking package. All money spent will be made fully transparent to the public.


If you’d like to support our campaign in its last week financially we’d be most grateful. We’d also really appreciate it if you could help spread the word on social media – if you don’t like making up your own tweets/posts we could suggest something like “LAST CHANCE: Support@FerretScot to investigate plight of people seeking sanctuary in the UK https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-ferret-s-first-investigation-fracking/x/11158527#/story#DemocraticJournalism”
We also plan to announce a celebratory meet-up soon, where we can meet to discuss what’s been achieved so far and build the wider Ferret community – we hope that some of you will come down. We will confirm the details shortly.
Thanks and thanks again!
The Ferret Team

story:
Hello!

Irvin Rivera here. I am a self-taught Fashion and Portrait photographer currently based in Los Angeles. 

I have been published at several local and international Fashion Magazines and have been featured at numerous publications as well.

In my three year journey as a photographer, I learned that there will be people who are willing to help you grow as an artist. Along the road, I learned that I will meet people who believe in my vision, people who can help me make things happen despite the lack of resources, funds, etc.

I encountered fellow creatives who are willing to invest time, effort and love to the project. I learned to work harder, I am continuously learning and am still yearning to learn more about the craft that’s why I am asking for your support so I can join the Palm Springs Photo Festival happening on April 27th-May 2nd.

Learn more about the festival here: http://www.2014.palmspringsphotofestival.com

I want to join Art Streiber’s whole day workshop for Editorial Photography and also experience one of the portfolio review sessions. One of my big goals in life is to be able to do shoots for various magazines all around the world and I believe that this seminar would enhance my creativity and skill as a photographer.

I am raising $1500 by April 20th to be able to go to the event. This would cover the Festival Fee, The Workshop Fee, Travel fare, and the Portfolio Review Fee.


Breakdown of expenses and fees:


ART STREIBER WORKSHOP: An Editorial Photography Business Crash Course $375

OPEN PORTFOLIO REVIEW $47.50

PORTFOLIO REVIEW $275

FESTIVAL FEE PER DAY $80 x 3 = $240

FARE + 3 NIGHTS OF LODGING and FOOD $500

What you get:

Check the perks that you will get for supporting me with this endeavor.

Any amount would really go a long way. Even sharing this video would mean a lot to me.

You can view more of my works at www.graphicsmetropolis.com and at www.graphicsmetropolis.tumblr.com

Thank you for your support!

Have a wonderful day ahead!

story:
Afganistan’a gidiyorum…

Ben Mahmut. Magma Dergisi, Seferihisar Doğa Okulu ve Doğa Derneği fotoğrafçısıyım. Marmara Üniversitesi’nde Fotoğraf Bölümü’nde okudum. Yaklaşık 10 yıldır fotoğraf çekiyorum. Başta Anadolu olmak üzere doğa ve doğa kültürü üzerine belgesel fotoğraf projeleri üretiyorum. Daha önce göçebe topluluklardan Sarıkeçililer ile 35 gün boyunca Mersin’den Konya’ya kadar Toroslar üzerinden göçtüm ve yaşayışlarını fotoğrafladım. Kuzey Afganistan’dan göçen Türkistanlılarla, Antakya Ovakent’te 25 gün boyunca yaşadım, fotoğraf çektim.

Türkiye’deki tecrübemden sonra farklı coğrafyalarda yaşayan göçebelerin yaşamlarına dahil olmak istiyorum. Kültürlerini, hayatı ve doğayı algılayış biçimlerini anlamak ve paylaşmak benim için çok önemli. Zamanın ve mesafelerin saatler değil günler üzerinden dillendirildiği, yolculukların at sırtında en az 4-5 gün sürdüğü bir coğrafyada yaşamak nasıldır? Zamanın olmadığı, paranın geçmediği bir topluğun hayata bakış açısı nedir? Merak ediyorum.  

Bugün yaşadığımızdan oldukça farklı bir bölgeye ve zorlu koşullara yapacağım yolculuğu gerçekleştirmek için çeşitli malzemeler ve teknik ekipmanlara ihtiyacım var. Destekleriniz öncelikle bu malzemeleri edinmem ve yolculuğu gerçekleştirmem için çok önemli. Hedefime ulaşabilmem durumunda yolculuk sırasında çektiğim fotoğraflardan ve yazılardan oluşan bir kitap yayınlamayı düşünüyorum. Yayınevleri konusunda araştırmaya başladım bile. Hedefime ulaşmam için katkı koyanlardan bazılarına imzalı kitabımı göndereceğim.

Pamir Dağları’nın 5000 metresinde nasıl bir yaşam var?

Afganistan'ın kuzeydoğusunda, 5000 metrelik irtifa yüzünden tarım yapılamayan, tek besin ve geçim kaynağının yaklar (Tibet sığırı) olduğu bir bölgede yaşamın nasıl şekillendiğini merak ediyorum. Bir dönem İpek Yolu’nun en gözde noktalarından birisi olan Wakhan Koridoru şu an medeniyetin en ücra köşesinde bulunan göçebe toplulukların yaşadığı yer. Bölgede yaşayan iki topluluğun göç sırasında durakladıkları yere bir yolculuk yapacağım. Wakhiler ve Kırgızlar arasında para geçmiyor, tüm alışveriş takas yöntemiyle oluyor. Üretim bu toplulukta paradan daha kıymetli, çünkü hayatta kalmak için paraya değil bu ürünlere ihtiyaçları var.

Wakhan Koridoru’na nasıl ulaşılır?

Nisan’da İzmir’den yola çıkacağım. Kabil’e ulaştıktan sonra Wakhan Koridoru'na 3-4 gün süren bir araba yolculuğu yapacağım. Wakhan Koridoru'ndan Pamir Dağları'nın 5000 metre yüksekliğine yaklaşık 5 gün at üzerinde gideceğim ve Wakhilerin ve Kırgızların yaşadıkları bölgeye ulaşacağım.

Peki bu yolculuk tehlikeli değil mi?

Yolculuğun güzergahı sebebiyle çeşitli zamanlarda IŞID ve Taliban tehdidinin yaşandığı bölgelerden geçeceğim. Özbek kökenli olduğum için Kuzey Afganistan’daki insanlara benziyorum. Gider gitmez edineceğim yerel kıyafetlerle bölgede sorunsuz yolculuk yapabileceğimi düşünüyorum. Şimdiden sakallarımı uzatmaya başladım.

Peki Afganistan’da yolumu nasıl bulacağım?

Afganistan’da savaş nedeniyle öksüz kalan çocukları okutan bir dernek ile iletişim halindeyim. Dernek başkanı Mehrab bana bu yolculuğumda eşlik edecek. Öğrencilerinden o bölgede yaşayan çocuklar sayesinde yolculuğuma dair tüm detayları önceden çözebiliyorum. Hatta Wakhan Koridoru’na ve sonrasında Wakhilerin yaşadığı bölgeye birlikte yolculuk yapacağımız atı şimdiden ayarlamaya çalışıyoruz! Van’ın Ulupamir isimli bir Kırgız Köyü’nde, Wakhanlı bir Kırgız göçebesinden yolculuk hakkında detaylı bilgi aldım.

Yolculuk için nelere ihtiyacım var?

Bu özel coğrafyaya yapmayı planladığım seyahati gerçekleştirmek benim için çok önemli. Yolculuk için gerekli malzemeler ve teknik ekipmanlar için 1500 dolara ihtiyacım var. Dönüşümde bunu bir kitaba dönüştürmek ve öğrendiklerimi, anladıklarımı, yaşadıklarımı paylaşmak ise en büyük hayalim. Kitabın tasarım ve baskı giderleri için de 2000 dolar gerekli. Yeterli miktarı tamamlayamadığım durumda elimden geleni yapacağım ve bu yolculuğu gerçekleştireceğim.

Bu hayale destek olursanız çok sevinirim. Bağış yapamasanız da çevrenizle paylaşmanız, etrafınızı haberdar etmeniz, kampanyamı paylaşmanız da büyük bir katkı sağlayacaktır.

Afganistan'ın kuzeydoğusunda, 5000 metrelik irtifa yüzünden tarım yapılamayan, tek besin ve geçim kaynağının yaklar (Tibet sığırı) olduğu bir bölgede yaşamın nasıl şekillendiğini merak ediyorum. Bir dönem İpek Yolu’nun en gözde noktalarından birisi olan Wakhan Koridoru şu an medeniyetin en ücra köşesinde bulunan göçebe toplulukların yaşadığı yer. Bölgede yaşayan iki topluluğun göç sırasında durakladıkları yere bir yolculuk yapacağım. Wakhiler ve Kırgızlar arasında para geçmiyor, tüm alışveriş takas yöntemiyle oluyor. Üretim bu toplulukta paradan daha kıymetli, çünkü hayatta kalmak için paraya değil bu ürünlere ihtiyaçları var.
Wakhan Koridoru’na nasıl ulaşılır?
Nisan’da İzmir’den yola çıkacağım. Kabil’e ulaştıktan sonra Wakhan Koridoru'na 3-4 gün süren bir araba yolculuğu yapacağım. Wakhan Koridoru'ndan Pamir Dağları'nın 5000 metre yüksekliğine yaklaşık 5 gün at üzerinde gideceğim ve Wakhilerin ve Kırgızların yaşadıkları bölgeye ulaşacağım.
Peki bu yolculuk tehlikeli değil mi?
Yolculuğun güzergahı sebebiyle çeşitli zamanlarda IŞID ve Taliban tehdidinin yaşandığı bölgelerden geçeceğim. Özbek kökenli olduğum için Kuzey Afganistan’daki insanlara benziyorum. Gider gitmez edineceğim yerel kıyafetlerle bölgede sorunsuz yolculuk yapabileceğimi düşünüyorum. Şimdiden sakallarımı uzatmaya başladım.
Peki Afganistan’da yolumu nasıl bulacağım? 
Afganistan’da savaş nedeniyle öksüz kalan çocukları okutan bir dernek ile iletişim halindeyim. Dernek başkanı Mehrab bana bu yolculuğumda eşlik edecek. Öğrencilerinden o bölgede yaşayan çocuklar sayesinde yolculuğuma dair tüm detayları önceden çözebiliyorum. Hatta Wakhan Koridoru’na ve sonrasında Wakhilerin yaşadığı bölgeye birlikte yolculuk yapacağımız atı şimdiden ayarlamaya çalışıyoruz! Van’ın Ulupamir isimli bir Kırgız Köyü’nde, Wakhanlı bir Kırgız göçebesinden yolculuk hakkında detaylı bilgi aldım.
Yolculuk için nelere ihtiyacım var?
Bu özel coğrafyaya yapmayı planladığım seyahati gerçekleştirmek benim için çok önemli. Yolculuk için gerekli malzemeler ve teknik ekipmanlar için 1500 dolara ihtiyacım var. Dönüşümde bunu bir kitaba dönüştürmek ve öğrendiklerimi, anladıklarımı, yaşadıklarımı paylaşmak ise en büyük hayalim. Kitabın tasarım ve baskı giderleri için de 2000 dolar gerekli. Yeterli miktarı tamamlayamadığım durumda elimden geleni yapacağım ve bu yolculuğu gerçekleştireceğim.
Bu hayale destek olursanız çok sevinirim. Bağış yapamasanız da çevrenizle paylaşmanız, etrafınızı haberdar etmeniz, kampanyamı paylaşmanız da büyük bir katkı sağlayacaktır.

story:
The Story behind Panta rhei

The constant and eternal flux of flowing of water, especially when subjected to the forces of nature, is an arousing phenomena.  How does something that moves vigorously and gracefully change so easily and become rigid and razor sharp? Everything changes.

There is something about water, that fascinates me. Perhaps it is its beauty and gracefulness that is so alluring. Perhaps it was the terrifying experience of drowning as a child that has forever haunted me.

Water in fact, covers 71% of the earth's surface and as we all know, is vital for all forms of life on earth. For a country like Iceland, known for the best and purest tap water in the world, 15,000 km2 of it's landmass is comprised of glaciers or free-flowing water. According to Climate Central, Iceland is also one of the fastest warming places on the planet and the annual volume carried away from melting glaciers could fill fifty of the world's largest trucks every minute for the entire year.

In 2009 I had the opportunity to visit this extraordinary country and as each day passed, I found myself gradually submerged into a photographic journey of Iceland's landscape. I had never seen glacial formations like that before, nor experienced water with such force and magnitude, and in so many forms all in one day.

Panta rhei or 'everything flows' comes from the original thought of the Greek philosopher Heraclitus of Ephesus. In Plato's dialogue, this philosophy was also captured in the quote, "Everything changes and nothing remains still".

While this exposition was brought about by sheer passion and is not a direct advocacy campaign for climate change,  it is a fact that the landscape of Iceland is rapidly changing, just like much of our planet is also disappearing. The goal of this exhibition is therefore to seize the opportunity to showcase through photography, the beauty and energy of a fragile and changing environment before the assault of global warming on it. Moreover, although the images were captured in Iceland, "Panta rhei" could have been a journey anywhere.

The Exhibition

Oculus Arts exists as a place where galleries, collectors and exhibitors can discover stunning and clever artwork form current artists around the globe.

One year ago, my photo "Gold Rush Hotel" (below) was showcased in Print Oculus: mobile device photography, a limited edition book published by Oculus Arts. As well, the photo was selected to be part of a juried exhibition of twelve outstanding photographs.

I am excited to collaborate again with Becky Parsons at Oculus Arts to hold my first North American solo exhibition. This exposition gives me the opportunity to showcase a brand new photo series titled "Panta rhei". It will display a selection of photos that have been buried in my archives since my trip to Iceland in 2009 and until now, have never been seen.

The exhibition is planned to launch in May 2014 with a grand opening event at the lovely QSQ gallery in Toronto. Dates and more details to be announced. In tandem with the Contact Photography Festival, the exhibition will run throughout the entire month of May.

Indigogo and your role

To be able to show my work is an honour and experience and I am extremely grateful for the opportunity.

Having a solo exhibition has been a lifelong dream for me since I picked up my first Nikon SLR camera. This exhibition taking place in Toronto, the most populous city of Canada, is also an amazing chance for me as a growing professional photographer to gain exposure. That being said, launching a small exhibition seems simple but like everything else in life, comes with several costs that add up.  For this I have chosen to use Indigogo's crowdfunding platform to raise the funds I need to make it happen.

As the photos are already shot, your donations will go strictly towards mounting the exhibition, including making limited edition archival giclee prints, framing and display, publicity material, gallery fees, travel expenses and catering. After all, if I learned anything from my time working in Denmark, it is that any event is always cozier with some drink and food! Finally working with Oculus Arts, there are future plans to take the exhibition on the road and any surplus funds will be put towards this endeavor.

When considering making a donation, please check out some of the exciting perks that Oculus Arts and I are offering. Also note that your contribution is not limited to the amounts indicated on the list of perks. For example, you may contribute $75CAD and in exchange, select any of the perks offered for contributions of $50 or less. For contributors living outside of North America, in addition to the perks, I will also email you photos of the opening event knowing that it would be difficult for you to come to the show.  But whether you make a donation or not, a way you can help is by spreading the word and sending along the link to this campaign to your family, friends, coworkers, or favorite bloggers who you think might be interested in my show.

Moreover, while your role as a financial or non-financial backer is an important one to which I will be forever grateful, something else I will cherish would be to also have my friends and family come out for the opening event of "Panta rhei" in May.

To see more of my work, please visit my website Leeworkstudio. Feel free to write me for more information. Thank you in advance for your support.

Portrait photo by Laurence Bortnick

story:
OK, So Sommer & Mike have no idea I'm doing this. They are such great people....let alone my family. They deserve so much! They had asked me for help with a homemade photo booth because of rising wedding costs and of course I said I would help. Well it thought I'd try this 1st, and worse case scenario we handle it the old fashioned way. Lets make their wedding photo dreams come true professionally! All money donated will go to securing a true professional photo booth for their wedding, anything left over will be donated to the Bride and Groom! Come on peeps! Lets make this happen! Oh yeah....... SHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH lets try to keep this a secret dammit! :)

Love Seano

story:
You're invited to be a part of producing INSTRUMENTHEAD -- a fine art hardcover book that presents musicians in a way you've never seen before.

Exhibiting my INSTRUMENTHEAD portraits has been a dream come true. I've collaborated with hundreds of artists, capturing the inseparable connection to their instrument and craft. Through this process I have been able to find my voice as an artist. I am often asked if there is a book of my work that is available for purchase. With your help, I hope to publish a full-color fine art book called INSTRUMENTHEAD.

      

(Wavy Gravy - hippie icon)

Music is My Passion; Photography is My Medium

I began calling people who were known for the instrument they played (as well as for their look and style). I asked, “How are we going to tell your story? How will people know that it is you, without seeing your face? What is it about you that makes you special?” The photo shoots became a collaborative exchange between the musicians and myself.    

          

(Michael and Bootsy, Instrumenthead shoot, 2010)


Unsung Sidemen and World Music Represented

Many of the musicians that I have photographed are “sidemen.” I have also photographed many people from various countries who play indigenous instruments and wear traditional clothes from their homeland. 

  

(Pride Chigwedere, Pedrito Martinez, and Zakir Hussain, 2010-2011)


Musicians Photographed

To date, over 400 musicians have been photographed for this project by setting up mobile studios all over, from backyards to music venues.  

     

(Pop-up studio, Chicago, 2010)


Portraits for INSTRUMENTHEAD have been taken all over the United States, as well as in Barcelona, Cape Town, and Rotterdam.

    

(Pop-up studio, Preservation Hall, New Orleans, 2010)


Just a Few of the Musicians Photographed for INSTRUMENTHEAD:

Bootsy Collins (James Brown, Parliament Funkadelic, Bootsy's Rubberband)

Johnny Winter (Solo Artist)

Matisyahu (Solo Artist)

Dave Schools (Widespread Panic)

Mickey Hart (Grateful Dead)

Jon Popper (Blues Traveler)

Kenny Olson (Kid Rock)

Derek Trucks (Allman Brother Band, Tedeschi Trucks Band)

Zakir Hussain (Shakti, Masters of Percussion)

Junior Brown (Solo Artist)

John Forte (The Fugees)

Kyle Hollingsworth (String Cheese Incident)

Pepper Keenan (Corrosion of Conformity, Down)

Lenny White (Return to Forever, Miles Davis)

Pedrito Martinez (Solo Artist)

Matt Abts (Gov't Mule)

Mark Guilianan (Beat Music, Brad Meldau)

Peter Keys (Lynard Skynard)

Sam Bush (Solo Artist)

Alto Reed (Bob Seger and The Silver Bullet Band)

Futureman (Bela Fleck and the Flecktones)

Jimmy Johnson and David Hood (The Swampers)

…and so many more! (You can see more musicians at Michael's website.)


INSTRUMENTHEAD Exhibitions

A few years ago, I had the opportunity to showcase my work on a grand scale. With the help of friends and colleagues I was able to transform a 50,000-square foot warehouse into a large-scale sensory experience that was free to the public. It went on for two weeks during Jazz Fest displaying 75 four-foot-tall photographs. Musicians, painters, and aerial artists were performing every day. 

Since the New Orleans show, I have created various pop-up exhibits inside the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival, The Lockn’ Festival in Virginia, the Piccolo Spoleto Festival in Charleston, the Muscle Shoals Music Association Holiday Party, Oz, a contemporary art center, in Nashville, The Country Music Hall of Fame, The NorthSea Jazz Festival, and The Big Blues Bender in Las Vegas. Once INSTRUMENTHEAD is published, I will have books for sale at future gallery shows, music festivals, and on my website.

(TNT show, Oz Arts Nashville, 2010)

INSTRUMENTHEAD book schedule

The design and production of a fine art book is a long and expensive process. We are aiming to deliver the book to IndieGoGo backers ahead of schedule, and we are projecting OCTOBER 2016 for delivery date.

What We Need and What You Will Receive:
  • With your help, our goal is to have an initial print run of 2,500 books. If we do not reach our goal, we will deliver the same quality final product to our contributors. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to expand the book by 48 more pages! I'm also giving a portion to some important charities - read on for more information!
  • We have reached out to printers to review samples and quotes. Now all we need is you! October 2016 is when we expect the INSTRUMENTHEAD (book) to ship out to IndieGoGo backers. 
  • All other perks, such as limited edition prints, postcards, lithographs, and show posters are available now, and will ship in December 2015. 

The Impact

With this IndieGoGo campaign I will be able to produce and publish INSTRUMENTHEAD. During the years I've worked with a number of great charities that have helped me and I have in turn have benefitted them through my exhibitions. With this campaign, 5% of the total amount that I receive will be distributed to the following 4 charities:

  • Tipitinas Foundation
  • Music Maker Foundation
  • New Orleans Musicians Assistance Foundation (NOMAF)
  • Rock the Earth
                                                     
                                     
                                                

        

Challenges and Moving Forward
  • I have put together a great team, and we've prepared as much as possible to make sure that this project runs smoothly. From this campaign, through the book design and production, to shipping out orders, we know what our next steps are and what deadlines we have to meet. The INSTRUMENTHEAD community has grown so fast that we know this is a book people want, and we've done the research to make this a success.
  • We do not have an advertising budget, so we're relying on grassroots word-of-mouth. Please tell your friends to visit and share Instrumentheadbook.com.


What Will the Book Look Like?
.[Sample Page Design - Not FINAL VERSION]

 

  

INSTRUMENTHEAD Specifications

Trim Size: 12 x 10

Pages: 256 pages (If we exceed our fundraising goal: 304 pages)

Text: 80 lb. matte white; 4-process color throughout

Endsheets: Endsheets to print 4-process color

Hardcover: Casebound cover 95 lb. gloss C1S white over 120 pt. board

Jacket: 4-inch flaps using 95 lb. gloss C1S white
Finishing: Laminated single-sided with 1.2 mil matte lamination; 4-process color; die­-scored and cut

Gatefolds: Two 2 x 4 page gatefold inserts (bound within full signatures) printing 4-process color throughout using 80 lb. matte white text stock

Shrinkwrap: All books will be shrinkwrapped unless they are signed by the author


Here are the Perks!
$18 - Postcard Set

                           



$35 - Signed Show Poster

                       




$75 - Signed INSTRUMENTHEAD Book                                          

                             

                                 (Cover subject to change!)

$200 - Previous Perks and Signed Lithograph

                           



$275 - FOUR (4) Signed INSTRUMENTHEAD Books

   


$495 - Limited Edition Gliceé 16x20

                                     

(Michael and Derek Trucks, backstage at the Ryman Auditorium, 2014)

$740 - Signed/Personalized Book & Artist's Proof 16x20

Artists Proofs are historically the first images printed, as part of preparation for final processing. There may be unique aspects, such as colors and cropping, only found in these original proofs.  Only 3 printed per artist.  We encourage you to leave a note if you'd like to discuss choosing the right piece of art for your home. Includes letter of authenticity.


$1500 - Signed/Personalized Book & Limited Edition Glicee Print 36x48  

                   

(Roy "Futureman" Wooten, 2014)

Only 15 fine art limited edition giclee prints in this size per artist. Choose from many Instrumenthead portraits available at http://squ.re/1LDhonn. We encourage you to leave a note to specify your choice, and your contact information if you'd like Michael to contact you to discuss the right piece of art for your home. Includes letter of authenticity.

Giclee prints are professional, museum-quality ink jet prints using archival inks and the finest and most durable archival stock options. A giclee print uses a combination of eleven archival pigment-based inks producing a significantly larger color gamut than you're used to with traditional print methods. The results are an unparalleled tonal range and color fidelity. All images will be printed on 100% Cotton Museum Rag Paper.


$2500 - Signed/Personalized Book & On the Set Experience
SIGNED  PERSONALIZED BOOK & ON THE SET EXPERIENCE. Join Michael as his assistant on the set of an Instrumenthead shoot. See the creative process behind these images up close and personal. Travel expenses are not included.
             
 (On set with Kenny Olson in Nashville, 2014)

$3500 - Personal Photo Shoot & 2 Signed/Personalized Books

For this perk, you will get to plan and conceptualize your very own photoshoot with Michael Weintrob. Includes hi-res digital files--great for a band or artist seeking incredible photography for promotion. Would also make a memorable experience for your family. Includes one beautiful 16x20  giclee print from your shoot. Does not include travel. Please include contact information so Michael can discuss schedule and details.

$10,000 - TEN (10) Signed/Personalized Books & 36x48 Limited Edition Print & INSTRUMENTHEAD Exhibition
Michael will bring the Instrumenthead exhibit to your home or special event! Includes personal and exhibit equipment travel. Limited Edition 36x48 Print Included (contact: info@instrumentheadbook.com for more info     
                 


$25,000 - Bring the Photos to Life!
TWENTY FIVE (25) Signed/Personalized Books & 36x48 Limited Edition Giclee Print, INSTRUMENTHEAD Exhibition & Concert
Instrumenthead Exhibit Concert. Michael will bring the Instrumenthead exhibit to your home or special event AND book a band of musicians from Instrumenthead to perform at your home or special event. Limited edition 36x48 giclee print included. Includes personal and exhibit equipment travel. (contact: info@instrumentheadbook.com for more info)

Thanks so much for reading!
