INSTRUMENTHEAD community has grown so fast that we know this is a book 
people want, and we've done the research to make this a success.

We do not have an advertising budget, so we're relying on grassroots word-of-mouth. Please tell your friends to visit and share Instrumentheadbook.com.




What Will the Book Look Like?



.[Sample Page Design - Not FINAL VERSION]
 

  
INSTRUMENTHEAD Specifications

Trim Size: 12 x 10 
Pages: 256 pages (If we exceed our fundraising goal: 304 pages)
Text: 80 lb. matte
white; 4-process color throughout
Endsheets: Endsheets to
print 4-process color
Hardcover: Casebound
cover 95 lb. gloss C1S white over 120 pt. board
Jacket: 4-inch flaps
using 95 lb. gloss C1S white 
Finishing: Laminated single-sided
with 1.2 mil matte lamination; 4-process color; die­-scored and cut 
Gatefolds: Two 2 x 4 page gatefold inserts (bound
within full signatures) printing 4-process color throughout using 80 lb. matte
white text stock
Shrinkwrap: All books will be shrinkwrapped unless
they are signed by the author

Here are the Perks!

$18 - Postcard Set

                           

$35 - Signed Show Poster





                       






$75 - Signed INSTRUMENTHEAD Book                                          

                             
                                 (Cover subject to change!)



$200 - Previous Perks and Signed Lithograph
                           


$275 - FOUR (4) Signed INSTRUMENTHEAD Books

   









$495 - Limited Edition Gliceé 16x20

                                     
(Michael and Derek Trucks, backstage at the Ryman Auditorium, 2014)


$740 - Signed/Personalized Book & Artist's Proof 16x20
Artists Proofs are historically the first images printed, as part of preparation for final processing. There may be unique aspects, such as colors and cropping, only found in these original proofs.  Only 3 printed per artist.  We encourage you to leave a note if you'd like to discuss choosing the right piece of art for your home. Includes letter of authenticity.

$1500 - Signed/Personalized Book & Limited Edition Glicee Print 36x48  
                   
(Roy "Futureman" Wooten, 2014)
Only 15 fine art limited edition giclee prints in this size per artist. Choose from many Instrumenthead portraits available at http://squ.re/1LDhonn. We encourage you to leave a note to specify your choice, and your contact information if you'd like Michael to contact you to discuss the right piece of art for your home. Includes letter of authenticity.
Giclee prints are professional, museum-quality ink jet prints using archival inks and the finest and most durable archival stock options. A giclee print uses a combination of eleven archival pigment-based inks producing a significantly larger color gamut than you're used to with traditional print methods. The results are an unparalleled tonal range and color fidelity. All images will be printed on 100% Cotton Museum Rag Paper.



$2500 - Signed/Personalized Book & On the Set Experience
SIGNED  PERSONALIZED BOOK & ON THE SET EXPERIENCE. Join Michael as his assistant on the set of an Instrumenthead shoot. See the creative process behind these images up close and personal. Travel expenses are not included.
              (On set with Kenny Olson in Nashville, 2014)



$3500 - Personal Photo Shoot & 2 Signed/Personalized Books
For this perk, you will get to plan and conceptualize your very own photoshoot with Michael Weintrob. Includes hi-res digital files--great for a band or artist seeking incredible photography for promotion. Would also make a memorable experience for your family. Includes one beautiful 16x20  giclee print from your shoot. Does not include travel. Please include contact information so Michael can discuss schedule and details.

$10,000 - TEN (10) Signed/Personalized Books & 36x48 Limited Edition Print & INSTRUMENTHEAD Exhibition
Michael will bring the Instrumenthead exhibit to your home or special event! Includes personal and exhibit equipment travel. Limited Edition 36x48 Print Included (contact: info@instrumentheadbook.com for more info     

                 




$25,000 - Bring the Photos to Life!

TWENTY FIVE (25) Signed/Personalized Books & 36x48 Limited Edition Giclee Print, INSTRUMENTHEAD Exhibition & ConcertInstrumenthead Exhibit Concert. Michael will bring the Instrumenthead exhibit to your home or special event AND book a band of musicians from Instrumenthead to perform at your home or special event. Limited edition 36x48 giclee print included. Includes personal and exhibit equipment travel. (contact: info@instrumentheadbook.com for more info)

Thanks so much for reading!

story:
The United Skateboard Photography Project Book


Brief History

Let me introduce myself, Jonathan Young, and the “United Skateboard Photography Project” to you.

I’ve been a skateboarder since the age of 4, I’m 42 years old today and I skate bowls, vert, mini ramp and street as often as I can still. In December 2012, I left the security of a full-time job to dedicate my time and energy to pushing the United Skateboard Photography Project.

Photo: Fred Ferand - Skater: me, Jonathan Young at this year's Vert Attack 8 in Malmö, Sweden

Skateboard photography, the photographers and the skaters have accompanied my experience with skateboarding for practically all of my life.

In December 2012 I decided that I would like to create a website and a book dedicated to skateboard photography and the photographers to present their work to a worldwide audience. At the same time I wanted to combine this effort with a donation from the sales of the book for a charity that works with skateboarders – now 100% of the book revenue from the book sales after German taxes (I live in Hamburg, Germany) will go directly to the Grind For Life charity foundation.

Charitable Cause I'm Supporting

Grind For Life, Inc was founded in 2003, by life-long skateboarder Mike Rogers, after his second battle with sarcoma cancer. Mike's tumor was located behind his right eye and nasal cavity. He endured a 17 hour surgery a cranial-facial resection with a brain-lift, removal of his eye, cheekbone, and half of the roof of his mouth and some of his teeth. He beat cancer once as a pre-teen, and again 25 years later. Mike beat the odds and is a competitive skateboarder again.

The mission of the Grind For Life organization is to provide financial assistance to cancer patients and their families when traveling long distances to doctors and hospitals. In addition, they educate and inspire these patients and families concerning cancer survival and recovery. Those who qualify may request assistance for travel and lodging expenses, meal, and personal needs.

Their ultimate goal with the organization is to have a couple of apartments near Memorial Sloan-Kettering Hospital in Manhattan, so people who are receiving treatment at the hospital can have their family near them. They want to be able to provide a comfortable place to stay, charge fees based on a sliding scale, provide support for those who are not accustomed to the city, and make a rough situation a little easier for those who travel long distances for treatment.

Photography In The Book

Here are just a few examples of the high quality photography that will be presented in our wonderful printed book!

Photographer: Grant Brittain / Skater: Chris Miller

Photographer: Jim Goodrich / Skater: Dave Hackett

Photographer: Mike Fick / Skater: Gu Gu

Photographer: Guillaume Ducreux / Skater: Florent Bavouzet

Photographer: Mark Nichols / Skater: Mark Leeman

Photographer: Sam Fidlin / Skater: Jesse Belrose


What The Project Needs

I'm doing this fundraising campaign because the project needs to raise the funds for the publication, shipment, marketing of the printed book and to be able to give the campaign supporters (that's you hopefully!) something back for your donation. I also have chosen to work with a  professional publisher ( Everbest Printing Co Ltd in Hongkong) who will print the copies of the book and deliver the high quality 300 page hardcover book. Here are the details:

  • I will print (at least) 1000 copies of the book

  • Each copy of the book will be hardcover 11.8" x 11.8" in size

  • Paper being used is 157 gsm matt artpaper China SPCo matt

Initial funds through this campaign will be used to pay the fees for the fundraising through Indiegogo (4%), the print and shipment of the book in Hongkong, and the shipment of the book to early contributors and the skateboard photographers featured in the book.

Any extra funds raised will go to supporting the Grind For Life organization, the skateboard photographers involved in the project and to continue work on the dedicated United Skateboard Photography Project website to create new projects in the future supporting non-profit organizations. 

Photographer: Fred Ferand / Skater: Steve Caballero


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Submit your photographs and if they are good enough, you can get your own member page on the website!

  • We would love it if you can spread the word about the project - on your blog, Facebook, Twitter, Google+, basically everywhere!

  • You can easily share the news about our project using social tools provided right here on Indiegogo.


A Few Of The People Involved

I can't show everybody involved in the project here - that's what the United Skateboard Photography website and the printed book are for. Here are just a few of the people who are supporting this project with their photography:

Grant Brittain - Production Manager/Senior Photographer/Staff Manager/PR/Photo Show Curator at The Skateboard Mag 

Jim Goodrich - he's been doing this for decades!


Mörizen Föche - one of the original Thrasher Magazine employees

Brian Fick

Dave Östlund

Dan Sparagna

Russ Sakurai

Lorrie Palmos

Graham Tait

Andy Wissman

and many many more! Visit the dedicated website to see them all.

Contact

Any questions about the project? Please contact me - Jonathan Young - by mail at info[at]unitedskateboardpp.com), on Facebook or Twitter!

story:
Short Summary

My work is based on fifteen years of travel and street photography coupled with digital manipulation.  This series, the Universe in Us, includes travel and street photos digitally composited with astronomy, biology and other science images.

What We Need & What You Get

I have a rich archive of travel and street photos to mine, but I need some better tools (computer, storage, printer, etc.) and funds to create high resolution prints and other items I can display in local art events and offer for sale.  

My hope is to also teach others to create art this way, and to learn to express freely and build sustainable income streams for themselves.

I'd also like to create videos, mixed media installations, and various other transmedia permutations of these themes.  I also write, and may incorporate the photos into books and other permutations.  Maybe even jewelry and clothing!

In exchange for your support, I will offer transformations of your favorite photos, or even make videos that spread your message.

The Impact

This is ultimately a community building enterprise, and a way of expressing what's good about the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am always interested in collaborations so please do contact me!

More Images:


In the Groove.


Time Rift.


We Are Connected.


See the Stars, My Baby.

Still more on Pinterest: http://pinterest.com/lgalarneau2012/the-univers...

story:
Shoot Film UK

An analogue community built for you, by you. Shoot Film UK have been promoting film based photographers from around the world to an international audience since 2016, free of charge and with the artists best interests at heart. Our goal is to continue supporting artists for many more years and we can safely say we've enjoyed it this far! 

In order to continue running the site you will know there are the occasional fees that are required to maintain the site including web hosting and domain charges. 

Although this campaign is based around pitching for funds to keep the site live and continue promoting film photographers through our open calls and artist features we thought this would be a pretty good time to talk about future ShootFilmUK plans.

So initially, what are we looking for?

  • Funds to pay for the website, to keep it live and continue sharing amazing work from the ever growing community of people who have contributed to ShootFilmUK and followed us.
  • Funds to cover the domain name www.ShootFilm.UK so that everyone who has linked to their featured work on the site wont lose out and people will still be able to reach us.

But as we mentioned, that's not all... If we reach our target, GREAT! However depending on the results of this IndieGoGo campaign we want to invest more into our artists.

Supporting ShootFilmUK

Funding a campaign like this is fantastic, it means a lot to the people requesting your support, but what about if we can spread that love further?

Here's our plan.

  • If we are able to reach our target the site will stay live, everyone will be happy and we can continue to publish and promote artists working with film.
  • If we exceed our target, we will be investing those funds back into ShootFilmUK in certain ways depending on how much we are able to raise.
  • For every 10euros over our target we will be sending a roll of film out to one of our contributing artists selected at random, so whilst your support helps the ShootFilmUK site stay active, you'll also be supporting the work of a film photographer, be it a student, a hobbyist or a professional!
  • Where will any extra money go? Well as we begin 2018 our plans to expand are always getting closer! Any money will go towards the printing costs of our first issues of ShootFilmUK Zines. Depending on how much we are able to raise we hope to have prints by the summer time. If however we are unable to raise enough to cover those costs we will put them back into the site through our 'My 24exp Project' and other contributor focused projects.

The Impact

By donating to this campaign you are not only helping ShootFilmUK maintain web-presence, you will be helping promote the work of hundreds of artists from around the world. 

Funds raised will help keep the site up to date and go towards future projects, all to continue building an already successful and strong community of analogue artists working in all areas and all formats of film photography.

Donating

As we are not asking for thousands of euros to release a product or start a business we are simply asking for people interested to donate as little or as much as possible to keep the site alive and as mentioned, anything extra will be passed on by supporting artists around the world with materials they need in order to produce new work.

Because of this we will be offering all who donate just a little something in return to say thank you for their generosity. This will be done in two ways:

  • All contributors will be mentioned on the website in a dedicated list of ShootFilmUK supporters.
  • All contributors will receive a special ShootFilmUK postcard, hand signed to say thank you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If you're unable to support us with a donation but wish to keep the site live there are other ways you can help support the campaign:

  • Publish the campaign on your blog, instagram, tweet about it and help us spread the word!
  • Use the share tools to get the correct links you need.
  • Share it with your friends and family on facebook.
  • Print out black and white screenshots of the campaign page and tape them on all the lamp posts as you walk to work in the morning.

Any support you are able to offer is greatly appreciated and the hundreds of artists you are helping support will all agree that without the kind support you have offered, none of this would be possible.

Thank you.

story:
Hi everyone this is Mike with stockphotoguy.com for those of you who don't already know me I'm a full time professional stock photographer.

Ive spent the last year and half creating stockphotoguy.com in my spare time as a way to start my own stock photo site and provide quality stock photos at a more affordable price for small media companies and designers.

Currently my work can be found on the Large Stock Photo Companies' websites which require all buyers to purchase either a monthly or yearly subscription starting around $200, or just a couple of photos starting at about $15 a piece. 

StockPhotoGuy.com allows the buyer to pick the photos, size and license agreement they need with instant download. 

Photos start at just $1 and there are no subscriptions required! 

StockPhotoGuy.com allows a buyer to pay a lot less, $14 dollars less in comparison. This is a tremendous benefit to those small businesses on a budget who want to spend their funds on exactly what they need and not purchase a subscription just to get a great deal on photos.

The reason I began StockPhotoGuy.com is because currently Large Stock Photo Companies take about 80% or more of all sales from its contributors and consistently make website and compensation changes that are destroying the income of their contributors. These Large Stock Photo Companies race to the bottom in price while flooding their websites with several millions of lower quality images with Hit and Go contributors.

Full time Stock Photographers are having their work lost in a flood of lower quality images from people who are not pursuing stock photography as a full time or part time career, but only want to make a few bucks.

The race of these Large Stock Photo Companies to have the most images is not only destroying the industry and their contributors but it is also making it more difficult for buyers to find what they want.

StockPhotoGuy.com is a targeted Niche Stock Photo Site and although my site is currently up and running I need to have the site professionally designed on the back end; the coding aspect of the site, to make the site more like a traditional stock photo site that can accept other Stock Photo Contributors and allow for quick and easy uploading of photos and descriptions. 

What I hope to accomplish is to save the Stock Photo Industry by creating a quality select site, showing other Career Stock Photographers how to breakout on their own or to have them join my site where their photos can be found and their work be compensated and treated fairly.

I would like to raise $30,000 to pay for the cost of website development and marketing. Having spoken to web developers, the coding required to complete a website much like the traditional stock photo site will range between $15,000 and $25,000. I also have a $5,000 to $10,000 Marketing budget to promote the site once it is completed.

To make StockPhotoGuy.com available to media companies, graphic designers, web designers, bloggers and all those in need of isolated object stock photos the funds raised toward marketing the site will be used for targeted magazine advertisements, direct mailers, Google Adwords, and guerrilla marketing techniques. My goal of $5,000 - $10,000 for marketing should be a good starting point for entry level advertising. 

If I do not reach my $30,000 funding goal, I will either still proceed with website development and market slowly over time as funds become available or skip website development and market the current version of the site until enough funds are earned to further develop the website. 

No matter what I will be proceeding forward with my plans for StockPhotoGuy.com

Please help support this independent stock photography website that creates a valuable service to consumers and contributors by donating towards launching StockPhotoGuy.com

Check out the Perks as a Thank You for your Help!

story:
WHY WE INK

Hi! I'm Jules, the founder and creator of Why We Ink. What started as an online forum for tattooed cancer survivors and those tattooed in memory of loved ones has now turned into something much bigger… something global.

Following a flood of viral media attention, an outpour of public interest and celebrity support, Why We Ink will now be made into a large format photographic coffee table book. The book will share inspiring stories of both triumph and loss, and feature beautiful imagery of cancer related tattoos, with all proceeds going to cancer care support groups.

As many who have endured the cancer journey know, there are so many groups that aid in the day-to-day support a cancer patient requires. Services like driving to and from Chemo/Radiation appointments, wig donations and in-home care are so crucial to the daily quality of life a cancer patient experiences. Raising money for cancer research will always be an integral component to fighting this terrible disease, but while we strive for a cure, there is still so much we can do to enrich the quality of life for those fighting now.

I lost my brother Owen to cancer 3 years ago, and during his battle it was these programs that made our journey a little easier and provided the comfort of knowing we were not alone.

Standing behind the Why We Ink cause is an amazing group of photographers from across Canada and the US who are currently shooting our real life cancer survivors, and friends or family members who have lost a loved one to cancer. In addition to the “real life” stories chosen from our online community, the book will feature many celebrities who are on-board share their stories and showcase their beautiful tats!

Our current team of supporting celebrities includes:

  • Ed Robertson
  • Rob Kardashian
  • Mia Michaels
  • "Big Ang" Angela Railoa
  • Bif Naked
  • Lisa Ray
  • Rob Dyer
  • Jesse Blacker
  • "Zombie Boy" Mr. Rick Genest
  • Brett Wilson
  • Sitara Hewitt
  • Izaak Smith
  • Tim Oxford

Some additional celebrities who have generously offered their support to the Why We Ink team are:

  • Emmanuelle Chriqui
  • Gavin Degraw
  • Jann Arden
  • Aliya Jasmine
  • Sarah Slean
  • Dan Hill
  • Scott Thompson
  • Matte Babel
  • Royal Wood

Please give our video a watch to hear our story and get a look at some of the amazing survivors and supporters that will be featured in our book!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to you to help us raise 50,000 dollars! This amount will cover the costs of printing and distributing the books. Once that is done, we will be selling the books and sharing all proceeds to cancer care support groups. In the wonderful event we surpass our goal, we will be printing even more books, and raising more money!

To show our sincere appreciation for your support, we have some amazing perks! Not only can you get copies of this gorgeous coffee table book, but you can receive:

  • Awesome comfy t-shirts!
  • Celebrity autographs!
  • Tickets to our star studded book launch in Toronto!
  • Tattoos!
  • Framed prints!
  • Your face in the book!
  • More! (check out the perks)

Our campaign is set to a fixed goal so it’s “go big or go home” funding. This means means we need every dollar to make this happen!

It Takes A Village

Why We Ink has so many wonderful supporters who we appreciate very much. From our celebrities and notable personalities, to our video production crew, book coordinator, PR team, web designer, social media interns and our photographers, everyone involved has donated their time, resources and most of all – passion! A shared and unwavering passion and belief that Why We Ink IS making a difference in the lives of cancer patients and those who battle alongside them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to show your support through a monetary donation you can always help by SHARING our page! We have people in the book from all over the world, and it would be great to share our campaign across all borders

Hit the share tools on the page to spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Eliška Sky Kyselková and I am Photographer & Art director. I made the new project IN THE WORLD OF HANAFUDA CARDS which intends to be a gate and homage to Japanese aesthetics and the beauty of nature.

I'm running this crowdfunding campaign to make large scale exhibition of this project. The funding will pay for the gallery hire, the private view and printing & framing costs.

The exhibition will consist of photographs, short fashion film and handmade set design. It will be an immersive journey into the fantastical world of Hanafuda cards.

 

What I Need & What You Get

My funding goal is £4000 which will cover the gallery hire, the printing & mounting, the transport & display of handmade props by the set designer of the project Lydia Chan, printing of exhibition materials and private view refreshments.

I'm offering various rewards for supporting this campaign

  • the possibility to join the private view of the exhibition
  • the Fair Trade heavy canvas design bag with original photograph from the project
  • signed and numbered photography prints
  • signed postcards
  • 1:1 session (online or personally in London) as private photography portfolio review
  • photoshoot for you or your brand 

I hope you can support me and help me to make my first solo exhibition in London! 

And if you can't contribute financially, please spread the word. 

Thank you in advance

 

Eliška Sky Kyselková

www.eliskakyselkova.com

story:
Photo Stack is designed from the ground up to help you learn, share & stay motivated with monthly photo contests and the chance to be included in our annual photo book.  Membership includes entry to all 12 monthly contests.

Everyone wants a great shot of those special momentsto look back on. Photostack is your chance to become a confident photographer able to take the shots that you and your family & friends will be proud of.

  • Over $250 each month in prizes.
  • Get those tips that can push your photography forward.
  • Meet some great people and have fun in a collaborative environment.
  • Show everyone what you helped create with our annual photo book.

Membership with access to all services and contests is available at a special Indiegogo price.

Each month we'll present a new info pack introducing that month's theme and providing enough information for you to get started.

The best way to learn and develop your skills is to get out there and start taking photos.   And our monthly contests and annual photobook provide the motivation you need to ensure your camera doesn't start gathering dust.

And our monthly contests and annual photobook provide the motivation you need to ensure your camera doesn't start gathering dust. 


Imagine telling your friends you've won a prize in one of our monthly competitions and that your photo is going to be featured in our annual photobook.  

We're all working towards becoming better photographers and creating the best annual photobook possible.

And our energetic community will encourage you to get out and share what you've been doing in our exclusive member's only hang-outs.  


You'll be able to meet some great people and gain advice on how to improve your photos.  Based on this feedback you can refine and select your best shots.

At the end of each month you will have the chance to vote on the top photos to be included in our annual photo book.  Whether you win or lose your photography will be improving and you'll be having a great time, but for the winners there are also a number of cash prizes to win.  

If you are selected as a winner then when that photo book comes around you'll also be able to show all your friends your winning entry in our beautiful 120 page photo book.


We've broken down our project goals to make it much clearer where all the money for this project is going.  Our first goal of $3500 helps validate the need for this project and will be used to deliver the twelve $250 prizes each month.  The remaining $500 will be used to offset our server hosting and administration costs.  Once the goal is reached we will add perks to purchase physical copies of the annual photobook at a special IndieGoGo price and start listing some of our stretch goals.

What is an information pack?

A: The structure of the information pack will change each month depending on the featured photographer and theme.  It will either be a tutorial, e-book or video with some great information/tips on how you can get started on that month's theme.

Are you going to take the copyright to my photos?

A: You retain the copyright to all your photos. You give us permission to use the images to provide the services we provide.  So we may use them for promotion, display on the web-site and in Photostack publications such as the annual photobook. 

What forum software will you be using to get started?

A: We are going to start off with xenforo for forum communications.  We also have custom software components that we will improve as needed, such as the contest upload and voting components.

Can I gift my perks?

A:  You sure can. When we contact you after the campaign just give us the email and/or physical address you want the items sent to and we will happily do so.

Will everyone have a photo in the annual photobook?

A: While we'd love to include a photo from everyone, only the top entries voted by you will be included.   Don't forget that all the support and advice you provide to other members will be what makes this photo book awesome, so this will be something that everyone can and should feel proud off.


This is your opportunity to experience a year of personal growth and a lifetime of benefits.  


By helping to create the Photostack movement you'll be part of an exciting community that makes improving your photography a whole lot of fun.  We’ve got all the elements put together to create a fantastic learning experience, but we need you to make this a reality.

story:
The Story

We live in a unique place on our planet. A couple of years ago, due to the circumstances, I had to leave my Homeland and leave for 6.5 thousand kilometers. During my stay in another part of our vast country, I could not find a place for my heartache. Upon returning, I realized that tormented my soul, namely the lack of unique nature of his native land. I missed the beautiful scenery with high mountains and large valleys, where the air is so clean that it is a pleasure to breathe it, the taiga forests, where there is a real unity with nature, as well as the most mysterious and interesting place in Siberia - lake Baikal.  

Baikal is the largest lake with fresh water, whose name is known all over the world, but few people can boast of having been here.

We decided to give you the opportunity to see the unique natural beauty of lake Baikal through virtual travel with reference to each locality, which are located along the coastline. 

Our team has been working on this project for a year. At the moment, we have filmed ¼ of the total length of the coastline of lake Baikal, which occupies a total of about 2000 km . In the near future it is planned to shoot the rest. The complexity of shooting arises from many factors.  


One of these factors is the difference in air temperature day and night, day on lake Baikal is very hot, and at night it is always terribly cold. In any case, when you go to Baikal, there is always a need to take your outer clothing with you. The water temperature in this unique lake rarely reaches 20 degrees even on the warmest summer day of the end of July, the beginning of August. Baikal freezes only in December, and finally covered with ice in February, thaws the lake only in mid-may.

Some of the photos we took were taken in rainy weather, which is very rare for the unique Baikal nature, where the sun shines 300 days a year.


For shooting the rest of the need not only to buy/rent professional equipment for panoramic shooting (if you are a manufacturer, we will be happy to cooperate with you), as well as the cost of transport, because in some places it is impossible to walk, and you can only swim or fly, and the journey can be complicated by the fact that the Baikal fauna is rich not only fluffy bunnies, but also brown bears:). About half of the coastline of lake Baikal is occupied by impassable mountain ranges, which hide many beautiful places.


 


The locals are always very responsive, happy to show the way and provide all possible assistance. And our stories and demonstrations of what we do have been met with enthusiasm and approval.

 

At the moment, we have created and are constantly improving the site, as well as the application for iOS. As already under development on the Android platform. Most of the panoramas that we have done, I want to reshoot because we are sure that their quality can be much better. Now we are happy to show you what we have already done. 

This project is very important for us and even if we do not collect the required amount, we will finish it, even if it takes a long time. 

 


Thank you!

story:
I want to show you how I create amazing photos. Step by step. Like a master class, but composed as a book.

I am thinking for already so much time HOW to create a really usefull book for people who want to learn photography. Basically, it is very simple. Someone who wants to learn about photography needs something similar to a workshop/master class. A good guidence throught the single steps of taking a picture: 

  1. Ideas about effect to achieve.
  2. Finding the right location & light.
  3. Camera configurations adjusted to the location and light.
  4. Photo retouching.

What you get

  • 15 chapters based on different photo genres (portrait, marriage, fashion).
  • every chapter is related to a specific photo explaining all important single steps required to create that photo + illustrated single steps for retouching.
  • you dont need to read the whole book in order to create your first AMAZING photo, just choose the photo you like the most and follow the instructions.
  • I promise you that you will be surprized how easy it actually can be!



Thanks for your trust. Contact me if you have any questions!

With best wishes,

story:
Summary

My name is Gabriel Daniels , and up and coming photographer from Queens , NY . Most recently I started up my own business , but I have one problem . The camera I'm currently using is not the industry standard , and I would to draw in more customers with better quality videos and pictures . 

The Canon xC10 would be a great compliment to my portfolio , and give me more creative control over the work that I produce. It is at a cost of $2000 , but just what I need to take my career and business to the next level . By making a contribution to this campaign , you will help a young photographer fulfill his dream of becoming a professional. The campaign is not limited to $2000 , so feel free to donate the amount that you desire. Every little bit helps

 

 

Make sure that you share this link with your family , friends , pastor , co-workers , etc. Everyone that plays a part in this campaign is so important . Your donate is vital , and will bring me closer not only to my dream as a photographer , but allow me to share my creativity with the word . Maybe even working for Vanity Fair , or XXL Magazine . I thank you for your support . 

 

Much Love , 

                   Gabriel Daniels , Entrepreneur , Musician , Playwright , Producer

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone. 

Thanks for visiting my page. I am a freelance photographer from Toronto Canada. Last year I took a courageous leap into doing photography as my full time gig. It has been a crazy year but definitely one for learning. Starting over for me was not an easy transition but it is worth every bump. 

The reason I need to do this is because everyone needs help when starting over or even just starting out. I have an opportunity to teach new students and aspiring photographers how to hone their craft and become better artists. This was something I learned the hard way but feel I can give back.

My goal is to be able to foster a few student, on photography, photo editing and self marketing. My target student would be one who wouldn't have the resources to pay for cameras or training.

My clients include

  • Madonna's Hard Candy Fitness
  • Toronto Fashion Week
  • Fuse Hair Studio
  • The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation - CBC
  • DeLux Hats
  • Sherbourne Health Center
  • Blake McGrath (Choreography)


Taken in the Distillery District in Toronto. 



What We Need & What You Get

I want to tutor 1 student for 3 months (1 lesson a week for the full 3 months) for free. 4 students a year. In that time I will help build them a portfolio and create a digital branding package with them to launch their brand.

Also, I will give the new artists an opportunity to work with me on paid events, building  a portfolio AND paying them.

I require

  • http://www.henrys.com/77480-Nikon-D7100-w-18-55-VR-Lens.aspx $1199
  • http://www.henrys.com/833-NIKON-AF-135MM-F2-0-D-DC-LENS.aspx $1399
  • http://www.futureshop.ca/en-ca/product/apple-apple-macbook-air-13-3-4th-gen-intel-core-i7-1-7ghz-256gb-laptop-silver-md761ll-a/10257698.aspx?path=346df9332652f01568a32bff2ba8116den02 $1549
  • Print and mailing cost for the project


Your Perks

The biggest thing I can give is my gratitude. I am grateful to have a chance to share what I have. 






The Impact

ART MATTERS!! We need to invest more time into the arts, and emerging artist.

I have a lot to give back to the community, my time, my knowledge and my friendship. I want to make a difference. SO DO YOU!!

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SHARE.. And share often. 

Post it to your Facebook. Let people know how they can help. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools: the more views I get, the better!

FINALLY. Be kind to everyone. The world needs more love!!
story_txt:
Short SummaryHello everyone. Thanks for visiting my page. I am a freelance photographer from Toronto Canada. Last year I took a courageous leap into doing photography as my full time gig. It has been a crazy year but definitely one for learning. Starting over for me was not an easy transition but it is worth every bump. The reason I need to do this is because everyone needs help when starting over or even just starting out. I have an opportunity to teach new students and aspiring photographers how to hone their craft and become better artists. This was something I learned the hard way but feel I can give back.My goal is to be able to foster a few student, on photography, photo editing and self marketing. My target student would be one who wouldn't have the resources to pay for cameras or training.My clients include
Madonna's Hard Candy Fitness
Toronto Fashion Week
Fuse Hair Studio
The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation - CBC
DeLux Hats
Sherbourne Health Center
Blake McGrath (Choreography)
Taken in the Distillery District in Toronto. What We Need & What You GetI want to tutor 1 student for 3 months (1 lesson a week for the full 3 months) for free. 4 students a year. In that time I will help build them a portfolio and create a digital branding package with them to launch their brand.Also, I will give the new artists an opportunity to work with me on paid events, building  a portfolio AND paying them.I require

http://www.henrys.com/77480-Nikon-D7100-w-18-55-VR-Lens.aspx $1199

http://www.henrys.com/833-NIKON-AF-135MM-F2-0-D-DC-LENS.aspx $1399

http://www.futureshop.ca/en-ca/product/apple-apple-macbook-air-13-3-4th-gen-intel-core-i7-1-7ghz-256gb-laptop-silver-md761ll-a/10257698.aspx?path=346df9332652f01568a32bff2ba8116den02 $1549
Print and mailing cost for the project

Your Perks
The biggest thing I can give is my gratitude. I am grateful to have a chance to share what I have. The ImpactART MATTERS!! We need to invest more time into the arts, and emerging artist.I have a lot to give back to the community, my time, my knowledge and my friendship. I want to make a difference. SO DO YOU!!Other Ways You Can HelpPLEASE SHARE.. And share often. Post it to your Facebook. Let people know how they can help. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools: the more views I get, the better!FINALLY. Be kind to everyone. The world needs more love!!

story:
Polo bikes, a photo project by Przemek K

This cycle of 143 photographs showing polo bikes mirrors the artist's fascination with personalised items and DIY


 

stretch goals

 Main Goal #1: EUR 1000

We will give (for free) 143 Limited edition prints, for all those whose bikes were photographed by Przemek during the European Hardcourt Bike Polo Championship 2013. 

We need money for  print on FineArt paper - Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta format print 30x20 cm ( 11 3/4 x 7 7/8"), one print costs 5 EUR each + cost of delivery.

Main Goal  #2: EUR 2500

+ Photo exhibition

Main Goal #3 : EUR 10000

+ Publication of a photo album of “Polo Bikes” including photos of Bike Polo Club Krakow

 

organisers

Przemek K  (born 1975 in Krakow) —  photographer .  He studied at Łódz Film School and won scholarships from the City of Krakow and an Austrian foundation X-CHANGE Culture Science. In his projects he concentrates on sociological observations and the ability to clearly portray representatives of social groups undergoing economic, social or cultural transformations.  www.photography.com.pl

Bike Polo Club Krakow- probably the best bike polo club in the world…We play each Thursday from 4 pm until dusk at the former Polfa swimming pool at ul. Eisenberga 2 in Krakow... Most often at weekends as well.
www.ehbpc.org/2013/

Art for art Foundation - www.artforart.pl

ZPAF – Polish Association of Artists Photographers – Kraków Branch,  www.zpafgallery.pl


delivery option:

You can pick up your item in Poland - for free:)  (during Bike Polo events) - instead of delivery. Just let me know.


contributions

10 EUR -  Thank you

You'll receive a big thank you and digital postcard.


20 EUR  Big Poster

Poster 100 x 70 cm / 38 x 27 in / showing all the photographed bikes
Please add EUR 15 to your order for  shipping. Please add EUR 25 to your order for shipping outside the European Union.


25 EUR – T-shirt with a print

A T-shirt with a collage showing all the photographed bikes
Please add EUR 10 to your order for  shipping. Please add EUR 15 to your order for shipping outside the European Union.

 

25 EUR – a bag with a print

A bag with a collage showing all the photographed bikes
Please add EUR 10 to your order for  shipping, please add EUR 15 to your order for shipping outside the European Union.

 

 

30 EUR – a unique T-shirt with a print

A T-shirt with one randomly selected photo of a bike. The photo from this T-shirt will not appear on any other T-shirt…
Please add EUR 10 to your order for  shipping, please add EUR 15 to your order for shipping outside the European Union.

 

30 EUR – a unique bag with a print

A bag with one randomly selected photo of a bike. The photo from this bag will not appear on any other bag…

Please add EUR 10 to your order for  shipping, please add EUR 15 to your order for shipping outside the European Union.

 

 

 

600 EUR – limited edition print

Limited edition print, Edition of 4+1AP, signed at the back, 90 x 60 cm, (35 x 23 in), 2013,  Archival Pigment Print, Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta paper / You can choose from the images of all the available photographed bikes.

 

1200 EUR  – three limited edition prints

I've put together three limited edition prints at a hugely reduced price. You can choose from the images of all the available photographed bikes.

Limited edition print, Edition of 4+1AP,  signed at the back, 90 x 60 cm, (35 x 23 in), 2013,  Archival Pigment Print, Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Baryta paper / You can choose from the images of all the available photographed bikes.

Thank you for all your support !!!!

story:
I have photographed over 15 beard compeitions in a little over over a year.  All of them have been for free and all of the photos have been released for free.  I need help in paying for more equipment but do not want to have to charge any beard clubs or members to do so.

 

These beard comps have worn down my eqipment, I don't only shoot beard comps, but have found that those who I have photographed have really enjoyed my work, and I want to continue to get photos out to people free of charge...but this has been taking a burden on my pockets.

 

Most of the beard comps that I photograph are in venues with very low light.  This requires a pretty expensive piece of equipment to get quality images.  I am trying to raise the money to pay for a particular lens that not only works well in these conditions, but will also give me a good range of bearded close-ups and wider shots.

 

This campaign to raise money is only open until February 14th.  If I raise the $2200 goal...fantastic...I will get the money and then buy the lens.

 

If I do not reach my goal, everyone's money will be returned, I get nothing, and may have to start charging per event to continue taking the photos that everyone looks forward to after all of the comps that I attend.

 

Please think about donating.  Anything will help and hopefully with your help I can continue what I love doing and what seems to make these competition even more exciting for everyone!

story:
Wine Calendar 2016

This campaign is not just about a calendar, it's about helping a dream to come true.

My name is Constantinos Dimitropoulos  and I'm involved in the "Greek Wine" sector through my website www.greekwineinsider.com. My dream is to go all around Greece in order to visit & meet over 150 winemakers, hear their story and, get to know more about the history of viticulture and winemaking in each region. My final goal after this trip, is to present to all wine lovers what the Greek Vineyard and Greek Wine is all about, through a publication with lots of scenery & aerial photos and of course written details.

Apart from wine lover, I'm a photography hobbyist so, what i offer in my campaign is a printed A4 size calendar for 2016 with photos coming from my personal portfolio.

The calendar will have 8 pages, one month on each page side + front & back cover, professionally printed on 150gr velvet paper.

Other Options

In addition to the calendar, a Trucker Mesh Hat is available in 3 different options, as seen on the following photo. Also, Mobile Phone Cases  are available for Apple 6S/6S Plus, 6/6 Plus, 5/5s, 4/4s & Samsung Galaxy 6S, S5, S4, in 5 different options.

  • Trucker Mesh Hat


  • Mobile Phone Cases




"By supporting my campaign you will help me fund my trip and consequently give me the ability to gather all the material i need for my publication."



What I Have

·  Successfully secured two Off Road vehicles by a major supporter that will take me around Greece: Land Rover Defender 90 + Arctic Cat 650 4x4 ATV

·  Canon 1100D + Canon 18-200IS lens

·  Handheld Garmin GPS

But i still need a lot more...

I will have to travel at least 4500km in mainland Greece and another 1500km on the 45 islands i plan to visit. Under my calculations i will be able to visit 2 winemakers per day at most, meaning that i will travel around for about 90 days or so.



What I Need

Having the above in mind i will need the sufficient funds to cover the following costs:

·  Gasoline

·  Accommodation

·  Food

·  ATV/ Car Preparation & Maintenance

·  Ferry Boat Fares

·  Unexpected costs


Funds will be used to:

· Cover the Processing and Printing Costs of the Calendar 2016

·  Upgrade my Photography Equipment (Exchange Current Camera Body with a Canon 760D, Get an Extra Lens & Professional Tripod)

·  Acquire a DJI Phantom 3 Drone for Aerial Photography

·  Laptop 15" With Sufficient RAM & Hard Disk

·  Image Processing by a Professional Illustrator




Other Ways You Can Help

If you are willing to help me in a different way, then you are welcome to do so. If you can help me with the equipment i need or by offering discount on accommodation it would be very helpful on reaching my goal.

story:
Welcome to my project, I am so happy you could make it!


My name is Mikkel Larsen, and I am a Photographer and Teacher currently living and working in Chongqing, China. I came to China in 2010 and I have worked for a couple of different schools over the past few years, finally settling in on a job here in Chongqing. Apart from my teaching I also do photography. I have had a camera attached to my hand since I spent a couple of months in Australia back in 2005.

As a personal challenge to myself and for, what I hope is, a nice gesture to this wonderful place that I live in, I have decided to start a kind of experimental photography project. I want to shoot and produce a photo book showcasing Chongqing as a beautiful city and province. Chongqing, is often covered in fog because it usually rains at night. As a result, the city, by the locals is often referred to as “Fog City” and as any major city in China, it battles with air pollution just like Beijing does, although not as severe. But even so, Chongqing, the city and munincipality is a beautiful place to live and visit, if you open your eyes and dare venture out. And this, is what I would like to show in my project, and hopefully, in my book once it is finished.

My project is a little special, because rather than me just going out and taking pictures all by myself, I want to try and create a small community around producing this photo book. I do have some pictures ready at this time, but I would like the community, people like you, to help me decide on locations, what pictures go into the final photo book and give ideas and feedback on layout. I will do all the research, I will do all the preparations and the work, but I would like a chance to reach out to the people who are interested in the book, and their view on what would be interesting to put in it. Also, I have teamed up with local Chinese people who will take me around to special locations, some, away from the normal tourist routes.

I am asking for funding here, to help cover the production cost of the photo book that I am going to produce at the end of the project The funds raised here, through your contributions, will go towards the initial copies that I will NEED to get started and getting people aware of my book after the project has concluded. The photo book is going to be called "A Portrait of Chongqing" and will be printed as an A4 Lay Flat photo book printed on high quality photo paper. It is going to look good, on YOUR coffee table and your friends are going to LOVE it as much as you are!

More details on the book will follow as the project progesses.


Here is my plan for the project as it moves forward over the coming year. I will post detailed updates on my project page as I move from preparation, into planning, shooting and post processing as well. You can find my project page here

www.mslarsen.dk/portraitofchongqing

Right now, I am still in the Funding phase, which will run until this campaign finishes in March. After the campaign has finished, I will post further updates on how I will move on from there.




Old cities like Gongtan in Chongqing province stand in sharp contrast to the modern development currently going on in  urban Chongqing. The city is growing fast and new, modern skyscrapers shoot up everywhere.

For those who choose the prints only perks, the pictures will become available as I finish them, but all the pictures in the book will be online on my website at the time that the book is finished so you can select your favorite print around fall also in time for Christmas.


At Jiefang bei, one of the more prominent shopping areas in Chongqing stands a monument of freedom, a big clock tower in the center of the square surrounded by named brand stores like Gucci, Armani, Prada and Emernegildo Zegna. 

Of course, some may not be able to contribute to help fund A Portrait of Chongqing but that does not mean you cannot help. In order to fund this project, i hope to reach as many people as possible. Therefore it would be very helpful if you could share this with all your friends and family. Share it through Facebook, Twitter, Google+, anything you would like. It all makes a difference and brings the book one step closer to becoming a reality.

In the spirit of Good Will, I have found a couple of other photography projects, that I think deserve your attention. I know that you cannot give to everyone and I am sure you are looking for the project that you find the most inspiring. 

If you only give once a week, please think of me next time.


Without People (http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/without-people/x/5710797)
A very promising campaign for what looks to be an amazing photo book.


Behind the Stache (http://igg.me/at/behindthestache/x/5710797)
Inspirational stories behind well groomed facial hair



Working Mama (http://igg.me/at/workingmama/x/5710797)
Women do not have to hide and be ashamed when they breastfeed their child(ren). They should be proud of who they are and which miracles they are able to do!


You can also find me here:
www.mslarsen.dk/portraitofchongqing

story:
I'm a native-born Canadian with a passion for photography digital art. I have always loved taking photos with a focus on flowers and insects.

The city in which I live has beautiful gardens that make a great photos to fill for magazines, websites, blogs, and stock photography. Currently, I only use my mobile phone to create these images with little photo editing, just raw talent. I'm hoping to upgrade my gear while also sharing some of my photos with my contributors. A phone camera is not cutting it for the kind of detail and beauty I wish to portray in the simple beauty of our world.

There is also an digital artist that has recently formed in me and would love to that have that grow. The program I use right now is good but it would be awesome to start using a program like Photoshop to really hone in and make artful creations from my photos. 

As a thank you, I would like to offer some of my photos and even take some of your portraits and make them into one-of-a-kind creations!

I understand if your tight on funds, as I suspect many of us are right now but even checking out my Facebook page and my website would be greatly appreciated! And, if you like what you see, please share with your people.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MakingBelief

Website: https://makingbelief.ca/products/

story: There was once a boy, who died with his dreams.
story_txt: There was once a boy, who died with his dreams.

story:
Cimetiere d'Ixelles

Dave Smith

Physicist by training, Educator by profession and Photographer by passion

I have spent decades teaching myself the Photographic craft and developing the art of Photography! Yet this is my first Photographic book. Even this project has been some years in the making.

My approach to presenting my Photography has been changing over recent years and I have come to the belief that the Photobook is the best way to get as many people as possible to see my Photography. There is a permanence about the Photobook that doesn't exist in any other way.

This documenting of the Cimetiere d'Ixelles is my first Photobook and this has rather opened the floodgates and I am now shooting for the next three books. The key has been discovering 'the story' for each project, the narrative that drives the images and it is this which demands the Photobook approach - having a series of images to tell a self contained story through those images. The narrative through the story from the Cimetiere d'Ixelles is particularly strong and has some interesting sidelines as well as a sad twist in the tale.

It is easy to make a photobook and indeed I already have for the mock-up to introduce this campaign ... where contributors come in is to take this project one step further to allow the printing of a set of books for sale to interested collectors, to bring the story to life as it were, because an untold story is only a dream!

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign seeks to raise 1500 eur

  • The bulk of this money is to cover the printing costs of the book at around 870 eur.
  • The Indiegogo fee is 50 eur
  • Credit card fees are 50 eur
  • Bank fees are 25 eur
  • Costs to produce the incentives are 500 eur

There are a number of 'perks' available to participants ranging from a simple thank you through to copies of the book itself as well as prints and other associated products ... check out the perks section to find out more.

The Impact

I am hoping that this first project of this kind for me will start a community of people interested in the imagery that I make and who want to support its further development. In particular, I am keen to see the resurgence of the Photobook which in its heyday of the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries was the method of choice for disseminating the Photographic Arts. It has rather fallen by the wayside with rising prices for printed matter in the latter part of the last century. However, the digital revolution has opened new doors and it is those that I am hoping to exploit. 

The idea of the tightly curated Photobook around a very precise theme or narrative is an important change in the current method of producing photobooks, which has tended to more and more images, bigger and bigger size until it is unwieldy in its weight as well as its content - we simply cannot comfortably view the contents any more!

I am interested in the reintroduction of the 'fascicle' from the early days of the Photobook when they were sold in installments, to keep the size manageable and the cost reasonable!

I am intending a series of Photobooks which will build a community as well as an ongoing collection. This may well change the way that we buy and view the Photographic Arts!

I am currently shooting for the next three projects;

  • the first of these is called ... pop. 600 about a very small village with a surprisingly large commercial center! A sort of documentary through commerce project!
  • the second is ... same but different about the hunter's chairs that are everywhere here and obviously built to a specific brief but each with its nuances of difference. A sort allegory to the human condition!
  • the third is ... working with nature about the field sheds and how they are made to fit in with nature rather than fight against it!

I have a fourth project in mind as well and many more to follow. But these should keep us busy for now. The aim for these projects is to tell the story through images and to keep that story tight and self contained so that the books never get too large, too costly or too unwieldy.

Risks & Challenges

I think that the only real risk to the success of this project is not reaching enough people who are interested in the project or the subject matter - and let's face it, images of a cemetery probably aren't everyone's cup of tea!

There are two ways to overcome this hurdle; firstly, I will be pushing my own communities online and offline very hard to try to get the project to as many people as possible. However, the second way to ensure success is for everyone interested in the project to do exactly the same, to push your online and offline communities hard to just look at the project. I am not suggesting any 'strong arm' tactics to get them to contribute, only to at least look they can then decide for themselves. Of course if everyone who looks helps at least by passing on the project to their communities then before we know it we will reach our targets and we will have built out own community.

Other Ways You Can Help

It may be that you are one of those not interested in the book or the images, but don't let that put you off. Firstly, even the smallest donations help ... remember that all big bits are made of little bits! But, if you simply do not want to make a contribution then that is absolutely fine ... in all honesty I am just glad that you came and looked. However, you may well know one or more people who would be interested

  • You can still help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help as well

Dave Smith

It may be that you are one of those not interested in the book or the images, but don't let that put you off. Firstly, even the smallest donations help ... remember that all big bits are made of little bits! But, if you simply do not want to make a contribution then that is absolutely fine ... in all honesty I am just glad that you came and looked. However, you may well know one or more people who would be interested

You can still help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help as well

story:
We love streets.

“We go back to some streets more often than others, not just because the things we have to do are more centered on one street than another. We may choose to focus a part of our lives on a street for reasons that are not necessarily economic or functional. Maybe a particular street unlocks memories, or offers expectations of something pleasant to be seen, or the possibility of an encounter. Because some streets are more pleasant than others, we may go out of our way to be on them, even on a trip to somewhere else.” Allan B. Jacobs, Looking, learning, making.

Reading the likes of urbanists, and writers, like Allan Jacobs, Bernard Rudosfky, Jan Gehl, Jane Jacobs, has changed the way we traditionally thought about what a street really is. We want to show why streets are so important for our cities, using the ideas of the people that know about them the best, the same people which ideas helped to create the structure of a master’s degree urban thesis for one of us in our team, and extending some of those ideas into a photographic project: a book called, I love Tokyo streets.

Why is the street important?

-Streets are more than public utilities, more than linear physical spaces that permit people and good to get from here to there (A.Jacobs). Streets are 80% of the usable public space in our cities (pps.org)

-“The street is where you go to see people, and to be seen by people” (A.Jacobs). The street is where cities come to life, it’s also one of the most important physical spaces, where identity and belonging to the city is born.

-We know the city through knowing our streets. We know the streets where the people we love live, we know the streets of the places we love to go. In a way of speaking, we know what we love better, in more detail. Imagine if we could love our cities more, and take more care about them, by improving our streets.

-Great streets are for everyone, if you have a car it’s ok, if you don’t it’s ok. This is the place where we are all the same, where democracy truly exists, and where we, together, can continue to grow and make our cities more humanized.

Why Tokyo?

As of recently, Tokyo has been named the most livable city on earth by the monocle magazine. The three of us feel this is the place to do this project. Being a megalopolis this size, we find it similar in some numbers to Mexico City (capital of our country), but there also are clear differences, huge differences.

"It manages to do something no other global metropolis can: provide a great quality of life for those who live there and also visit. From culture to security, food to courtesy, it has everything covered," Monocle says of Tokyo. "London and New York, take note."

We want to show that, and why, in a very high measure, great cities are among a lot of other things, a result of having great streets. This is the way we see to contribute to the city cause in our country, where the cities are transformed and developed by the economics of greed, not the human need.

What do we need, and what do you get from this



Who are we?

We are Emmanuel, and José, two architects from Mexico that met in the university nine years ago. Nowadays, our bond has increased by some of the passions we share, like the love for the city, and for photography. The two of us are pursuing a master’s degree, two of us went on to learn about the city and how it works, and our thesis are all about public space and the street.

As urbanists we had the opportunity to attend the World Urban Forum 7 in Medellín, Colombia. It was astonishing to see how a city can change so much and become one of the great examples in Latin America in the way of city planning, especially after those violent and sad decades, we have those problems too, in our country, Mexico. In the end, it’s reassuring to know that there are solutions for the city and its people. We believe some of those problems are solved in the streets: safer streets, busy streets, make great cities, with more options, more humanized ones too.

As photographers, we have been involved in different adventures, where we have learn more and more about the discipline. The two of us like different style of photography, and besides that, we possess other different skills, one of us is great approaching to people, another one of us has basic Japanese language skills. In the end, if the two us are able to go, the richer the final product will be. Recently, we began another adventure in that area, Storygoggle.com where we collaborate with Antonio, a longtime friend, is also helping us in the design department for this project, he also loves photography. Storygoggle is on its very early days; it is a place to show not only our photographs, but to tell the stories we keep in them. In the future, we would like to make Storygoggle available in more languages (it's only in Spanish right now), to reach more people like you, and to invite you to join us and tell your story. 

Risks and challenges

Most of us have been doing photography for as long as 9 or 10 years now (courses included), but we do not make photos for a living. Our biggest strength is that we love the city. As architects, and urbanists, our approach to the matter will be closer to the knowledge we have. As we mentioned, we are combining different skills, and it all helps. Photography was chosen as the medium to send this message, because as it happens, is also something we love.

We have an 11 days plan for doing the shots we need for our project. This plan is based on a schedule made to visit the areas and streets that we have identified as interesting (if you want to contribute here, all help would be greatly appreciated), that are representative of Tokyo, and that are viable for us to shoot there. There is some previous work we will have to do regarding to the city itself, long distance scouting, of everything we are going to see when we arrive there, the history and characteristics of important streets, social and cultural general knowledge, are most of those tasks.

When we arrive in Tokyo, there’s also some work to be done, for example, go to the locations themselves with pen and paper, and recognize how they work, what do they mean to people, what is a great Tokyo street, maybe if time permits sketch what calls our attention most (if we do it, we will include it in the book as a bonus). All this previous, and in situ work, will help us to identify what, where and how, we have to photograph.

After our trip, we will go through the selection process of our pictures, then, the editing will be done using tools like adobe photoshop, and lightroom. We will do the graphic design, and we’ll be using other adobe tools to create the book ourselves. 80%-90% of the book will be pictures, he rest, observations, about the people, the city, and the streets. The project will be divided by areas, and we will show our journey in a map for all of you to know, where is what, when talking about streets in Tokyo. For the printed versions of the book, we will be using blurb.com platform to deliver the best quality possible for this kind of job. The book in both versions, will be between 80 and 90 pages long.

Other ways you can help us?

If you can’t contribute right now, you can help us in many other ways. Go to our page, storygoggle.com, for more information. Please consider sharing this campaign in your social media accounts, or telling the people you know that are crazy in love with Japan, or cities, or photographs, the more reach we can have, the better, thank you everyone!

We care and are passionate about cities, and specially their streets. We think all of the people have to do more for our cities, because helping them, within our possibilities, big or small, is helping ourselves. I love Tokyo streets is just the beginning.

story:
About us

Hello Everyone! 

We are Kyudotsg! Kyudotsg is a self funded project that aims to find people or objects that are cute and specialise in photos that have a certain Japanese style to it in Singapore!

We have been involved in several photo books previously, but we are aiming higher and decided to head into the international market. Therefore, this project is very important to us as this will give us new opportunities and gain experience that could help us grow and produce more and better works!

The model we are featuring is Tsuki, she has been largely involved in cosplay and casual shoots with Kyudot. As a team we share the same joy and delight achieving photos and different themes, spending hours inspiring and helping each other to become better at what we do and this is her first big project in getting her ideas together in one book as a product! This will be one of our stepping stones to reach higher heights, Thank you for being a part of it!

What will be featured in this book

One of the lingerie photo set is previewed in the cover photo, to give you an idea of what to expect in purchasing this photo book and it's other perks! 
This photo book will be featuring 2 lingerie, 1 bikini, and a seifuku themed photo set  ( Gravure/ mild NSFW ) 

Perks Explained

Personalised Thank You Card

The thank you card will be emailed to you each containing a personalised message by Tsuki !

The content will be secret , designed and specially made for every individual :)

Prints

Each set of prints contains a small personal thank you message as well as a signature by Tsuki herself. Please feel free to contact us if you wish to have more than 1 so you can share with your friends! 

Photo book

Each photo book will be signed on the first page, do drop us a note if you do not wish to have it. The book contains 40 quality pages all ( 6" x 8" ) size. 

Behind the scenes video footage

This will be specially recorded for the shoots, it will contain a director cut by Tsuki herself, to show you the process of the shoot itself and exclusive content that will not be released anywhere else! 

Personal Costume Request

You will be able to direct one of the shoot and even chose what she wears! You may also give a bit of art direction and at the end, there will also be 10 photos chosen and printed separately onto 4R size and delivered to you!

Please do note however, Tsuki will not portray herself nude and will only work with what she is comfortable with. Please respect her decision if she denies your request! You will be able to have a discussion with the photographer and Tsuki herself so lets make this work! :D

 

The Impact

Prints have gone a long way since paper was invented. With the advance of technology, books, magazines and photo cards has been depreciated. However there is this attraction of prints that seem to attract people who continue to purchase them. The ability to touch and feel the actual paper is different than looking at it from the computer screen. 

With the success of this project, we hope to also give you this experience outside of Singapore! 

It would also be extremely encouraging for Tsuki as she has a strong passion to develop bigger projects and more concept shoots that she could be proud of, and hoping even more she can reach out to people that she can share her achievements with.
This project would help her fund her daily allowance and future endeavours as well!

Goals

500 USD - The minimal amount needed to print the books. Everyone who backed $2 or more will receive an extra photo card! 

700 USD - A great step ahead! We would have never expected this! More Photocards (3 more) will be given to those who backed $10 or more! Kudos to everyone! ( in addition to the photo cards )

1000 USD - A leap towards the miracle! We would have never imagined! Thank you everyone!! Extra 10 pages with another set of costume will be added into the photo book! WE ARE CRYING LITERALLY!!! ( in addition to the charms and photo cards )

 

Risks & Challenges

Kyudotsg have been involved in several photo book before therefore the possibility of this project failing is out of the question. The quality of the photos is also assured as you can see from the few photos displayed here that will be included in the shoot. We will also be working with a printing shop that we frequent often with excellent quality. 

Here are some of the things to expect when you receive the photo books / cards

Paper - Premium Silk180 gsm

Package - Bubble wrapped in an envelope

Delivery - Registered article with tracking

 

Contact and Relevant Information

For more information you can contact us here at indiegogo or www.facebook.com/kyudotsg. 

For more photos of the previous works Kyudotsg has worked in you can view them here at www.kyudotsg.com

Find out more about Tsuki on her facebook page!

 https://www.facebook.com/rflectionsecrets/
