story:
"Bus" The end of an era (1949-2013)

A photobook & calendar celebrating 64 yrs of the iconic Volkswagen Type 2

Depending on where you are in the world, the Volkswagen Type 2 is affectionately known by a number of nicknames, but whatever it's called, it holds a special space in our collective psyche! 

It has headlights that look like eyes, a badge for a nose, a bumper that presents a wry smile and a tendency to break down at the worse possible time and place (but is thankfully easily repairable).

It represents the dreams and aspirations of an entire generation and embodies the idea of “freedom” in one big lovable bundle of tin, steel, vinyl and rubber. Just load up the van, grab some friends and head down the coast to chase down some waves.

In the US it's known as the "VW bus", or “vee-dub”, a "minibus", a "hippie van", a “combie” or just simply "The Bus”.

In the UK its the “Camper”. In Australia & South America the “Kombi”. Affectionately called the "breadloaf” in Portugal and the "Rugbrød - ie. rye bread " in Denmark and the “Kleinbus” in Chile and Finland.  It's the "Volksie Bus" in South Africa.

Apart from being the ultimate hippy mobile of the 60’s, it was also embraced for more utilitarian purposes.

Some became hearses, refrigerated vans, taxi's, food trucks, ambulances, postal vans, police vans, military vehicles or specialty tradesman vans. Now many lay in a field somewhere, a rusty monument to another time, secretly hoping that some nostalgic soul will restore it to its former glory.

The "old bus" graced covers of iconic Bob Dylan and Beach Boys record albums and is forever linked to the Grateful Dead and their legion of fans that chased the band across the US.

Even Steve Jobs is said to have sold his VW van to buy circuit boards to build one of the first Apple computers.

Sadly, after 64 years of faithful service, the Type 2 Volkswagen bus will cease production this December in its last bastion - Brazil’s Sao Paulo. The German’s and Americans stopped production in 1979 because of tougher road safety regulations and now the Brazilians are to do the same.

VW produced over 10 million “bricks on wheels” and it's a testament to the original design that so many are still going strong. All made possible by millions of backyard VW mechanics who trade and swap parts to the point of obsession.

Even though the famous type 2  has stopped rolling off the production line, "the bus" will forever live in our imagination and folklore.

Who am I?   I'm a project manager by day and and a Kombi tragic the other 16 hours of the day. My wife is wonderful photographer, so with her help, we hope to inform, entertain and reminisce about everything Type 2 Vee Dub!

Who are you?  Hopefully you love the "old bus" as much as we do (or know someone who does) and are willing to support this last hurrah to the icon of 20 century alternative motoring.  It's also quite possible that if you are between the age of 30 and 50 years old you may have been conceived in the back of one. That may explain your peculiar attraction to corduroy, paisley prints and sandals...

 What You Get

A beautifully produced 96 page journey into the heart and soul of this 20th century cultural icon. As many color photos as I could pack into the back of an old Kombi, together with some history, some weird and wonderful conversions and an "up close and personal" look at some owners . Even if you have never owned or driven one, you may have noticed that Kombi drivers give each other a secret wave as they pass on the highway. I attempt to delve into this secret society of VW aficionados and try to figure out what makes them tick.

You can support this project by selecting one of the cool perks. I've self published before, so I understand the challenges ahead and we are 100% committed to delivering all perks by the end of November if we reach the fixed funding target.

That's were you come in....

Choose an electronic version of the book for only $9 or if you would prefer the feel and smell of real paper (like I do), I'll send you the real thing from only $39 if you get in quick. (see the early bird perks to the right). 

The book is to be printed in portrait format 8.25" x 10.75"  by a leading worldwide printhouse, printed on super quality fine matte, acid free, fully recyclable stock with perfect binding (ie it has a proper spine). It will be printed on demand in one of 4 facilities across the US and Europe, depending on which is closest to you. This means there is no waste or unsold copies - with the bonus of fast door to door delivery with the smallest possible environmental footprint. That's why I've included shipping in the perk pricing and it's so low. A big sorry for those in Oz (like me), Asia, Africa or South America. Your shipping (also included) is a little more expensive since there is no similar print facilities in these regions.

The Fixed Funding goal of $US 2,500.
So why have I chosen fixed rather than flexible funding? If you help me get to the target, that's when production volume discounts kick in and I've kept the perk prices low to reflect this volume.

If you don't fancy a book, and you have an empty space on the wall in your Man-Shed, score the massive 17 x 11" 2014  Wall Calendar for only $25. Replace that tired old girly skin calendar with something that has a real body designed get you through all next year!

Meet some of the stars

"Moe"

"Moo"

"Rat"

"Bluey"

"Gus"

"Rusty"

"Barbie"

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can contribute to this campaign, and that's by telling your friends and family or spreading the word by sharing the link to this exciting project.

Are you a Kombi freak and want to contribute to the book?

I'm not just crowd funding this project but  also seeking submissions for the book!

If you have a unique VW bus or know somebody that does - show it off in the book! Please contact me via email poprascal@gmail.com. Photo's before and after would be great and I'll send you some questions about your VW bus project. Who knows you may be the star of the book!

A big thanks to everyone who has contributed to this project!  Check here for regular updates and I hope to see you on the highway!

Good Karma to the following folks who have kindly provided some images to kick off the campaign!

Diego Torres Silvestre, Michael Coghlan, Tetsumo, mike, jmv, bk2000, Mike Jokela, St0rmz, Kutakizukari, ravas51, Seth Anderson, oldbarbeachfestival.com.au, Five Starr Photos, JOHN LLOYD, albumcovergallery.blogspot.com.au, Kevin Dooley, Dennis Wong, Tony Hisgett, 

Also check out some of the YouTube clips in the gallery to wet your appetite.

Please help us make this book and calendar a reality!

peace 

Gary & Sarah   x

It represents the dreams
and aspirations of an entire generation and embodies the idea of “freedom” in one big lovable bundle of tin, steel, vinyl and rubber. Just load up the van, grab
some friends and head down the coast to chase down some waves.
In the US it's known as the "VW bus", or “vee-dub”, a "minibus", a "hippie van", a “combie” or just simply "The Bus”. In the UK its the “Camper”. In Australia & South America the “Kombi”. Affectionately called the "breadloaf” in Portugal and the "Rugbrød - ie. rye bread " in Denmark and the “Kleinbus” in Chile and Finland.  It's the "Volksie Bus" in South Africa.
Apart from being the ultimate hippy mobile of the 60’s, it
was also embraced for more utilitarian purposes.
Some became hearses, refrigerated vans, taxi's, food trucks, ambulances,
postal vans, police vans, military vehicles 

 or specialty tradesman vans. Now many lay in a field somewhere, a rusty monument to another time, secretly hoping that some nostalgic soul will restore it to its former glory.
The "old bus" graced covers of iconic Bob Dylan and Beach Boys
record albums and is forever linked to the Grateful Dead and their legion
of fans that chased the band across the US.Even Steve Jobs is said to have sold his VW van to buy circuit
boards to build one of the first Apple computers.


Sadly, after 64 years of faithful service, the Type 2 Volkswagen bus will cease
production this December in its last bastion - Brazil’s Sao Paulo. The German’s and Americans stopped production in 1979 because of tougher road safety regulations and now the
Brazilians are to do the same. 
VW produced over 10 million “bricks on wheels”
and it's a testament
 to the original design that so many are still going strong. All made possible by millions of backyard VW mechanics who trade and swap parts to the point of obsession.
Even though the famous type 2  has stopped rolling off the production line, "the bus" will forever live in our imagination and folklore.Who am I?   I'm a project manager by day and and a Kombi tragic the other 16 hours of the day. My wife is wonderful photographer, so with her help, we hope to inform, entertain and reminisce about everything Type 2 Vee Dub!
Who are you?  Hopefully you love the "old bus" as much as we do (or know someone who does) and are willing to support this last hurrah to the icon of 20 century alternative motoring.  It's also quite possible that if you are between the age of 30 and 50 years old you may have been conceived in the back of one. That may explain your peculiar attraction to corduroy, paisley prints and sandals...

 What You Get
A beautifully produced 96 page journey into the heart and soul of this 20th century cultural icon. As many color photos as I could pack into the back of an old Kombi, together with some history, some weird and wonderful conversions and an "up close and personal" look at some owners . Even if you have never owned or driven one, you may have noticed that Kombi drivers give each other a secret wave as they pass on the highway. I attempt to delve into this secret society of VW aficionados and try to figure out what makes them tick.
You can support this project by selecting one of the cool perks. I've self published before, so I understand the challenges ahead and we are 100% committed to delivering all perks by the end of November if we reach the fixed funding target.
That's were you come in....
Choose an electronic version of the book for only $9 or if you would prefer the feel and smell of real paper (like I do), I'll send you the real thing from only $39 if you get in quick. (see the early bird perks to the right). 

The book is to be printed in portrait format 8.25" x 10.75"  by a leading worldwide printhouse, printed on super quality fine matte, acid free, fully recyclable stock with perfect binding (ie it has a proper spine). It will be printed on demand in one of 4 facilities across the US and Europe, depending on which is closest to you. This means there is no waste or unsold copies - with the bonus of fast door to door delivery with the smallest possible environmental footprint. That's why I've included shipping in the perk pricing and it's so low. A big sorry for those in Oz (like me), Asia, Africa or South America. Your shipping (also included) is a little more expensive since there is no similar print facilities in these regions.
The Fixed Funding goal of $US 2,500. So why have I chosen fixed rather than flexible funding? If you help me get to the target, that's when production volume discounts kick in and I've kept the perk prices low to reflect this volume.
If you don't fancy a book, and you have an empty space on the wall in your Man-Shed, score the massive 17 x 11" 2014  Wall Calendar for only $25. Replace that tired old girly skin calendar with something that has a real body designed get you through all next year!
Meet some of the stars

"Moe"
"Moo"
"Rat"
"Bluey"
"Gus"
"Rusty"
"Barbie"Other Ways You Can Help
There are other ways you can contribute to this campaign, and that's by telling your friends and family or spreading the word by sharing the link to this exciting project.
Are you a Kombi freak and want to contribute to the book?
I'm not just crowd funding this project but  also seeking submissions for the book!
If you have a unique VW bus or know somebody that does - show it off in the book! Please contact me via email poprascal@gmail.com. Photo's before and after would be great and I'll send you some questions about your VW bus project. Who knows you may be the star of the book!

A big thanks to everyone who has contributed to this project!  Check here for regular updates and I hope to see you on the highway!Good Karma to the following folks who have kindly provided some images to kick off the campaign!
Diego Torres Silvestre, Michael Coghlan, Tetsumo, mike, jmv, bk2000, Mike Jokela, St0rmz, Kutakizukari, ravas51, Seth Anderson, oldbarbeachfestival.com.au, Five Starr Photos, JOHN LLOYD, albumcovergallery.blogspot.com.au, Kevin Dooley, Dennis Wong, Tony Hisgett, 
Also check out some of the YouTube clips in the gallery to wet your appetite.
Please help us make this book and calendar a reality!
peace 
Gary & Sarah   x

story:
My name is Alex. I've been practicing and studying photography for many years and I now feel that I am nearly ready to become a professional photographer. My dream is to be able to travel the world and document that beautiful thing called 'life'.

In just under a year I am hoping to be able to set off on my journey, but I have a problem; I don't have the photography equipment I need and what I need is quite expensive, especially with my low income.

What I will use the funds for

Becoming a photographer can be very expensive and i can´t do it without your support.

With the funds i raise here i will upgrade to a better camera, get several lenses, filters, lights, editing software, cover the cost of hosting, business cards and some marketing.

I will be eternally grateful for your support!

Love, cheers and many thanks to everyone!

Love, cheers and many thanks to everyone!

story:
The Inspiration...

Where Flowers Grow began three years ago when we adopted our son and daughter from Ethiopia.  From that moment on, Ethiopia became a part of our heritage as well.  A year and a half ago, I knew that it was time to return and do something more for Ethiopian orphans.  


Photography is one of my loves, so I decided to leverage it in Ethiopia.  After researching numerous organizations and talking with people in country, I was referred to Ebenezer Grace Children's Home, a growing orphanage in Hawassa, Ethiopia serving 36 orphans.  Knowing the needs of their growing organization, I decided to create a coffee table book to generate awareness and funding for what they do.  

So in May 2014, I traveled to Ethiopia and spent 11 days with these amazing children.  Their stories were inspiring, their lives were simply beautiful.  It was effortless--I took over 2,000 digital images, 700 Polaroids, and 600 Instax prints.  Many of these I gave to the children and workers at the orphanage.  The rest I reserved for the coffee table book.  I chose to use vintage Polaroid cameras for many of the shots, because I believe it best represents who they are: one-of-a-kind, precious, and worthy.  It imparts an organic, timeless aspect to the images as well. 

 

I created a prototype of this book, 11"x8.5" in size, featuring black and white fine art images.  The final version will be 68 pages with large 5 inch images and text that honors the lives and relationships of the people I met there.  The photos include both vintage Polaroid images and digital images.  Your support of this project will allow for an initial press run of 400 copies, most of which will be sold to benefit Ebenezer Grace Children's Home.  

To meet this goal, I need to raise $5,500.  The funds will help me design, set the book up for print, have it printed, and shipped.  My goal is simple: honor the lives of these children and caregivers, show the world how beautiful and amazing Ebenezer Grace Children's Home is, and to help inspire funding for their work in Ethiopia.  

The hard part is complete!  I've traveled to Ethiopia, taken the pictures, processed the files, and designed the book!  Now the only thing left is to have it printed!  If you want to see what you're supporting, you can view all the images HERE!  You can also review the initial draft of the book HERE.  I have some cool perks for  your pledges, so please take a look--your support means the world to me!

As far as risks and challenges, since I have not published a book before, there may be some design issues or logistics issues that may have to be massaged a bit.  In that event, I have a designer consultant on hand who can address those concerns.  The bigger challenge is obviously funding.  If the interest is low, then that will reduce the number of books that will be created.  If for some reason this project doesn't reach it's goal, whatever funds I raise will be used to create a smaller run of books and perks.  Because if I've learned anything from Ebenezer Grace Children's Home, it is: "do not despise the day of small beginnings"!

To learn more about Ebenezer Grace Children's Home, please visit their WEBSITE.  If this resonates with you, please tell your friends and use Indiegogo's "Share" tools to get the word out...and thank you again for your interest--it means the world to me!

Respectfully, 

Steve

story:
Hi, I'm Abigail Price, I'm currently attending the School of the Art Institute of Chicago for a BA in Art History, Theory, and Criticism.  I am also a fine art and documentary photographer. 

I am creating a photo series and essay that will explore the  impact of global media on the perception of femininity in terms of sociology and psychology.  It will dissect relationships among families, friends, and partners in addition to religion, sexuality, fictional stories, the Bible, mythology, and the media.  I am shooting this in 6 by 7 medium format color film and there are 29 different sets that I will be designing and photographing.  Exploring the Feminine will be submitted to multiple art publications.

The funds raised here will be used for props, costumes, transportation, medium format film, processing of film, food for crew and models.

We will be shooting on April 27th, 2019 but we need the funds by April 20th.  The series will be released in June 2019. 

Here is the Budget Breakdown:
Transportation: $50
Food for Crew and Models: $150
Medium Format Film: $75
Processing Film: $55
Costumes, Props, and Materials: $600
=$930

This project has been a long time coming for me and it means so much to me.  If you support me, you are contributing to something much bigger than a photoshoot and helping a college student create something personal and authentic.  

Thank you for your time and I appreciate whatever support you can give!

story:
It all started with a meme...

Male Rompers have been all over social media.  The guys who started this trend has been plastered all over my facebook wall for a week now.  So as a joke, I posted a couple meme's and eventually I was called out.  

"You have mentioned men's romper a several times lately...I'm wondering if you are in the market for a romper. If you let me know your size I will be on the lookout for one for you." - Funny Cousin

What did I do?

Well first I had to sit back and think about it.  Who hasn’t seen the pictures of the dudes in the pastel rompers? THEY LOOK COMFORTABLE AF! So yeah, I'd sport a Men's Romper!  So I accepted the challenge! 

"If you buy it I'll wear it!" - Me

And that’s when it happened..

What Happened?

I got called out by a bunch of friends who said they would pitch in for a photoshoot! 

Now I've never done a photoshoot before, but you can bet your Romper wearing butt I'd do it. 

That’s when it hit me!

Reality? 

No! I should drag some of my sexy friends into this as well and we should make the world first Men’s Romper Calendar! I've always wanted to create something that people would point at me and say "That’s the dude that did a thing." AND THIS IS MY CHANCE!

Together we can create this monst.. Calendar and kick this dare in the butt!

 

How will it happen?

Once we reach our goal we will get things rolling.  I have priced the material and got a photographer on standby! If funded this will happen and will happen quickly so you can have your Mens Romptastic calendars in your hands ASAP!

story:
Short Summary

For years, we have been working on presentations of objects with focus on tourism, we make websites, interior photos, panoramas for Google Maps (Google Street View Trusted Photographers), and for some time we have been fascinated by drones and presentation possibilities of facilities and places they allow. We know that peoplo love to see more than from the ground and aerial 360 panoramas are perfect for sightseeing.

We started to make aerial panoramas and combine them into virtual tours from the air and it is drawing more and more attention and interest. That's why we started to combine aerial panos into one common platform with virtual tours.

The basis for this platform are panoramic photos from the air so we set the first target to create virtual tours around 15 places on the East Baltic Coast in Poland. We want the whole tour to be based on 150 panoramas. We currently have 40, we need resources to add another 110.

We have calculated the amount we need on average for one panorama - 130 $. We are able to do 30% alone, so we need about 90 $ on average for one panorama. The goal is 110 panoramas, that is 9900 $, but regardless of whether we can achieve the goal every 90 $ support will add another panorama in the tour. And if we get more, we will be able to make more panoramas in other regions of Poland.

 

Background

When you are going to any place to spend your free time, you usually want to know where you are going. You browse photos on booking.com, look for information on tripadvisor.com, check the website of the objects you are going to visit.
Usually on these pages you can see photos that show how the object looks like inside and outside. Most often photos are taken from the ground, although more often you can view the pictures from the air. However, mostly these are pictures showing only the object and the places selected inside.

360 photos became a great innovation, which can be seen more often in Google Maps as part of Street View, showing a view around - in each direction. The next step  is the so-called Business View, i.e. pictures of interiors and objects that can also be placed in Google Maps. Thanks to them, you can see the object in detail, everything inside is there is nothing to hide. Then you know where you are going and what you pay for.
Ok, but you are not sitting inside all the time, so what about the neighborhood?

Here Google Maps with satellite photos are very helpful, allow you to see the area from the air, get an idea of ​​the location of the object and the surrounding attractions. Unfortunately, they are often of poor quality, not always made with favorable weather conditions and often outdated.

Surely, photos from the drone showing the surroundings and objects are more interesting, but they have a limited perspective to the selected frame, they do not show the whole area.

But ... from the air you can also take panoramic 360 photos that allow you to look around! Thanks to that, we can also look around the area from a bird's eye view!

What if these photos are as well combined with each other in a virtual tour like this?

 

 

About project

For years, we have been dealing with the presentation of objects, we make websites, interior photos, panoramas are Google Maps (Google Street View Trusted Photographers), and for some time we have been fascinated with drones and presentation possibilities of facilities and places they allow.

Pictures from the drone allow you to look at objects and surroundings from a perspective that we do not watch on a daily basis, which is why they are so attractive. They also show larger areas. For over a year, we have started to take 360 ​​panoramic photos from the air, which give even more presentation possibilities! We take such photos for clients and combine them with virtual tours from the ground, it lets you see practically everything!
However, these are single pictures. In the next steps we came up with the idea to connect more with each other and create an aerial virtual tour - for example around the city. Due to our location, we began to create a virtual tour around Sopot - a beautiful tourist city in northern Poland on the Baltic Sea. But there are so many beautiful tourist areas around, that we went a step further and started planning a bigger tour ... and a very large project was created!
And because it requires resources that currently exceed our capabilities, we decided to look for support and that's why we are on indiegogo.com and we count on your help!

Idea

Our dream is to create a virtual tour from the air in attractive tourist areas all over Poland to allow them to be seen from the air and to facilitate the selection of places to visit live and this way promote Poland and encourage tourists to visit this beautiful country.

To make your dream come true you have to start working on it and take the next steps, so we started with a tour on the Polish Baltic Coast, the most popular tourist area, especially in the summer. We've developed a plan, we've chosen places and we've started working. The result of this work is a demo tour consisting of 40 panoramas around the Tri-City - an agglomeration of cities of Gdańsk, Gdynia and Sopot. We can continue the project ourselves, but we know that it can take a lot of time - a few months. For pictures to look good they should be done in good weather, on a sunny day, and the number of such days is limited. Well ... winter is comming! ;)

Therefore, if we wanted to continue, we would not end it this year, we could return to the pictures in May, when it will turn green again.

But ... we can make it this year - if we collect funds for development.

 

Process

How the process of creating the tour looks like:
1. We take pictures - approximately 25 photos per one panorama
2. Each of the photos needs to be prepared - colors, light, contrasts, etc.
3. The single photos are later stitched into a 360 panoramic photo
4. Panoramas combines into a virtual tour with the help of software that allows you to view them and move between panoramas
5. In a virtual tour we place markers for points - tourist facilities, hotels, restaurants, etc. Ultimately, we want to expand them with descriptions of selected places, photos and links, this will be the most time-consuming part of the project, which we can also complement and expand later.
We are able to do each of the stages of work independently, but this work is very much and it would take us a few months. But we can speed it up by commissioning selected stages outside.
It is particularly critical to take pictures as soon as possible, so that we can make it this season, while the leaves have not fallen from the trees :)

Costs

Because we have already done a lot of work, we are able to estimate the time and costs of the entire project.

The cost of one panorama including the shooting / purchase of photos, processing, stitching and programming the tour is about 130 $ at market rates. In order to make a trip this season, we have to outsource about 70% of the work outside, especially fast shooting on sunny days, because it has to be done in the same time. This means that we need about 90 $ for each panorama, which will be in a tour. We will do the rest of the work ourselves!

 

Target: Stage 1 - Virtual Tour of Baltic East Coast in Poland

As we started thinking about the project, we comprehensively prepared a virtual tour plan all over Poland. Such a project will take a lot of time. But to check if it meets interest at all, we want to first perform Stage 1 - a tour along the coast.
We've chosen 15 tourist destinations of great popularity for this tour, in total the tour will be based on 150 panoramas from the air. Below is a list of selected places:

As part of the demo version that we have prepared, we have today 40 panoramas of 3 major cities - Gdańsk, Gdynia, Sopot.

You can see it here:

  • Gdańsk (14 panoramas): http://visitpoland.online/gdansk/
  • Sopot (14 panoramas): http://visitpoland.online/sopot/
  • Gdynia (12 panoramas): http://visitpoland.online/gdynia/

All the panos we are publishing on our new facebook profile as well: https://www.facebook.com/VisitPolandOnline

 

What We Need & What You Get

The entire tour is to consist of 150 panoramas in the final version, which means that we still need 110 panoramas, that is a total of 9900 $ support for this stage to be successful!

What if we do not collect this amount? Each 90 $ is another panorama, so we'll make as many panoramas as we have enough resources. So the tour will grow anyway!

 

You will be able to see results on our Facebook profile, where we will publish all the panoramas from our virtual tour: https://www.facebook.com/VisitPolandOnline

 

What if we gather more? Then, without waiting, we will move with the next panoramas so that the dream of a virtual tour around Poland will come true :)
Our big idea is to take a tour over the majority of tourist areas in Poland, after finishing one stage, we will go to the next one.

Next stages:

Stage 2 - Warsaw and Cracow - most popular tourist cities in Poland (D1, D2)

Stage 3 - Zakopane and Polish Mountines (C1)

Our big idea is to take a tour over the majority of tourist areas in Poland, after finishing one stage, we will go to the next one.
Below we show the map that we have prepared. There are 5 main zones on it:
A. Baltic Coast
B. Masurian Lakes - the land of lakes
C. Polish Mountains
D. Larger tourist cities in central Poland and their surroundings
E. Other smaller interesting places in Poland

So - if we succeed in completing the first stage, we will go straight to the next one. And if our work will meet interest and we will be able to obtain the appropriate funds, we are able to complete the entire project by the end of next year, so let's get started :)

What's next? Not only Poland.

And what next? If we are able to implement such a project in Poland in cooperation with local drone operators and photographers, then we can also continue it in other countries .. and we are already thinking about it, but first let's do our first stage!

Risks & Challenges

Main risk is the weather. "Winter is coming" so we do not have much time to shoot photos, so the sooner we start the bigger the chance that we will be able to finish the project this year. So the faster we manage to collect funds the more panoramas we can include in our project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

>> Share our social media conten

If you like the idea of our project and would like to contribute it another way as well you can follow us in social media and share our content to draw more attention and help in promotion of the project.

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/VisitPolandOnline

>> Help is to find partners and promotion channels

We are looking as well for partners: patrons, sponsors, brands, influencers, bloggers or any other people and companies that would like to help in our project and promotion.

>> Not only in Poland

If you would like to have virtual tours in your city / resort / hotel or any other object or area please let us know as well.

 

So if you:

  • like the idea
  • would like to see next panoramas
  • would like to help in promotion of Poland
  • would like to be a part of The Biggest Virtual Tour in the world
  • all points above ;)

please help us in finishing this project!
story_txt:
Short Summary
For years, we have been working on presentations of objects with focus on tourism, we make websites, interior photos, panoramas for Google Maps (Google Street View Trusted Photographers), and for some time we have been fascinated by drones and presentation possibilities of facilities and places they allow. We know that peoplo love to see more than from the ground and aerial 360 panoramas are perfect for sightseeing.
We started to make aerial panoramas and combine them into virtual tours from the air and it is drawing more and more attention and interest. That's why we started to combine aerial panos into one common platform with virtual tours.
The basis for this platform are panoramic photos from the air so we set the first target to create virtual tours around 15 places on the East Baltic Coast in Poland. We want the whole tour to be based on 150 panoramas. We currently have 40, we need resources to add another 110.
We have calculated the amount we need on average for one panorama - 130 $. We are able to do 30% alone, so we need about 90 $ on average for one panorama. The goal is 110 panoramas, that is 9900 $, but regardless of whether we can achieve the goal every 90 $ support will add another panorama in the tour. And if we get more, we will be able to make more panoramas in other regions of Poland.
 
Background
When you are going to any place to spend your free time, you usually want to know where you are going. You browse photos on booking.com, look for information on tripadvisor.com, check the website of the objects you are going to visit.Usually on these pages you can see photos that show how the object looks like inside and outside. Most often photos are taken from the ground, although more often you can view the pictures from the air. However, mostly these are pictures showing only the object and the places selected inside.
360 photos became a great innovation, which can be seen more often in Google Maps as part of Street View, showing a view around - in each direction. The next step  is the so-called Business View, i.e. pictures of interiors and objects that can also be placed in Google Maps. Thanks to them, you can see the object in detail, everything inside is there is nothing to hide. Then you know where you are going and what you pay for.Ok, but you are not sitting inside all the time, so what about the neighborhood?
Here Google Maps with satellite photos are very helpful, allow you to see the area from the air, get an idea of ​​the location of the object and the surrounding attractions. Unfortunately, they are often of poor quality, not always made with favorable weather conditions and often outdated.
Surely, photos from the drone showing the surroundings and objects are more interesting, but they have a limited perspective to the selected frame, they do not show the whole area.
But ... from the air you can also take panoramic 360 photos that allow you to look around! Thanks to that, we can also look around the area from a bird's eye view!
What if these photos are as well combined with each other in a virtual tour like this?
 

 
About project
For years, we have been dealing with the presentation of objects, we make websites, interior photos, panoramas are Google Maps (Google Street View Trusted Photographers), and for some time we have been fascinated with drones and presentation possibilities of facilities and places they allow.
Pictures from the drone allow you to look at objects and surroundings from a perspective that we do not watch on a daily basis, which is why they are so attractive. They also show larger areas. For over a year, we have started to take 360 ​​panoramic photos from the air, which give even more presentation possibilities! We take such photos for clients and combine them with virtual tours from the ground, it lets you see practically everything!However, these are single pictures. In the next steps we came up with the idea to connect more with each other and create an aerial virtual tour - for example around the city. Due to our location, we began to create a virtual tour around Sopot - a beautiful tourist city in northern Poland on the Baltic Sea. But there are so many beautiful tourist areas around, that we went a step further and started planning a bigger tour ... and a very large project was created!And because it requires resources that currently exceed our capabilities, we decided to look for support and that's why we are on indiegogo.com and we count on your help!
Idea
Our dream is to create a virtual tour from the air in attractive tourist areas all over Poland to allow them to be seen from the air and to facilitate the selection of places to visit live and this way promote Poland and encourage tourists to visit this beautiful country.
To make your dream come true you have to start working on it and take the next steps, so we started with a tour on the Polish Baltic Coast, the most popular tourist area, especially in the summer. We've developed a plan, we've chosen places and we've started working. The result of this work is a demo tour consisting of 40 panoramas around the Tri-City - an agglomeration of cities of Gdańsk, Gdynia and Sopot. We can continue the project ourselves, but we know that it can take a lot of time - a few months. For pictures to look good they should be done in good weather, on a sunny day, and the number of such days is limited. Well ... winter is comming! ;)
Therefore, if we wanted to continue, we would not end it this year, we could return to the pictures in May, when it will turn green again.
But ... we can make it this year - if we collect funds for development.
 
Process
How the process of creating the tour looks like:1. We take pictures - approximately 25 photos per one panorama2. Each of the photos needs to be prepared - colors, light, contrasts, etc.3. The single photos are later stitched into a 360 panoramic photo4. Panoramas combines into a virtual tour with the help of software that allows you to view them and move between panoramas5. In a virtual tour we place markers for points - tourist facilities, hotels, restaurants, etc. Ultimately, we want to expand them with descriptions of selected places, photos and links, this will be the most time-consuming part of the project, which we can also complement and expand later.We are able to do each of the stages of work independently, but this work is very much and it would take us a few months. But we can speed it up by commissioning selected stages outside.It is particularly critical to take pictures as soon as possible, so that we can make it this season, while the leaves have not fallen from the trees :)
Costs
Because we have already done a lot of work, we are able to estimate the time and costs of the entire project.
The cost of one panorama including the shooting / purchase of photos, processing, stitching and programming the tour is about 130 $ at market rates. In order to make a trip this season, we have to outsource about 70% of the work outside, especially fast shooting on sunny days, because it has to be done in the same time. This means that we need about 90 $ for each panorama, which will be in a tour. We will do the rest of the work ourselves!
 
Target: Stage 1 - Virtual Tour of Baltic East Coast in Poland
As we started thinking about the project, we comprehensively prepared a virtual tour plan all over Poland. Such a project will take a lot of time. But to check if it meets interest at all, we want to first perform Stage 1 - a tour along the coast.We've chosen 15 tourist destinations of great popularity for this tour, in total the tour will be based on 150 panoramas from the air. Below is a list of selected places:

As part of the demo version that we have prepared, we have today 40 panoramas of 3 major cities - Gdańsk, Gdynia, Sopot.
You can see it here:

Gdańsk (14 panoramas): http://visitpoland.online/gdansk/

Sopot (14 panoramas): http://visitpoland.online/sopot/

Gdynia (12 panoramas): http://visitpoland.online/gdynia/


All the panos we are publishing on our new facebook profile as well: https://www.facebook.com/VisitPolandOnline
 

What We Need & What You Get
The entire tour is to consist of 150 panoramas in the final version, which means that we still need 110 panoramas, that is a total of 9900 $ support for this stage to be successful!
What if we do not collect this amount? Each 90 $ is another panorama, so we'll make as many panoramas as we have enough resources. So the tour will grow anyway!
 
You will be able to see results on our Facebook profile, where we will publish all the panoramas from our virtual tour: https://www.facebook.com/VisitPolandOnline
 
What if we gather more? Then, without waiting, we will move with the next panoramas so that the dream of a virtual tour around Poland will come true :)Our big idea is to take a tour over the majority of tourist areas in Poland, after finishing one stage, we will go to the next one.
Next stages:
Stage 2 - Warsaw and Cracow - most popular tourist cities in Poland (D1, D2)
Stage 3 - Zakopane and Polish Mountines (C1)
Our big idea is to take a tour over the majority of tourist areas in Poland, after finishing one stage, we will go to the next one.Below we show the map that we have prepared. There are 5 main zones on it:A. Baltic CoastB. Masurian Lakes - the land of lakesC. Polish MountainsD. Larger tourist cities in central Poland and their surroundingsE. Other smaller interesting places in Poland

So - if we succeed in completing the first stage, we will go straight to the next one. And if our work will meet interest and we will be able to obtain the appropriate funds, we are able to complete the entire project by the end of next year, so let's get started :)

What's next? Not only Poland.
And what next? If we are able to implement such a project in Poland in cooperation with local drone operators and photographers, then we can also continue it in other countries .. and we are already thinking about it, but first let's do our first stage!
Risks & Challenges
Main risk is the weather. "Winter is coming" so we do not have much time to shoot photos, so the sooner we start the bigger the chance that we will be able to finish the project this year. So the faster we manage to collect funds the more panoramas we can include in our project.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
>> Share our social media conten
If you like the idea of our project and would like to contribute it another way as well you can follow us in social media and share our content to draw more attention and help in promotion of the project.
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/VisitPolandOnline
>> Help is to find partners and promotion channels
We are looking as well for partners: patrons, sponsors, brands, influencers, bloggers or any other people and companies that would like to help in our project and promotion.
>> Not only in Poland
If you would like to have virtual tours in your city / resort / hotel or any other object or area please let us know as well.
 
So if you:

like the idea
would like to see next panoramas
would like to help in promotion of Poland
would like to be a part of The Biggest Virtual Tour in the world
all points above ;)

please help us in finishing this project!

story:
Short Summary

I have always wanted to travel the length of the coast of Ireland to find the hidden coves and overlooked inlets.  To me the Wild Atlantic Way became my siren call and again I found myself as a tourist in my adopted home. 

The Wild Atlantic Way was developed to promote tourism along the series of linked roadways that make it up.  I want to be a part of that endeavour by creating a catalogue of time lapse photo clips of sites along the entire route. 

There are so many benefits of this project:

  • An organized catalogue of clips and still images assembled by location, duration and special attributes. 

  • Clips will include both common and more obscure way points and surrounding locations.

  • These clips will be made available to communities, businesses, and civic and tourism agencies to advertise the route.  Each clip will be available with generous licensing rights for extended use.

  • A unified view of what the Wild Atlantic Way was like in 2017.  Provide a set of baseline images for the period from 2017-2018 that can be used in the future to measure use and activity.

What We Need and What You Get

We are asking for assistance to raise €16,500. 

The project will take almost a year to complete.  Most of the field work will be done during the summer, autumn, and winter of 2017-2018.  The clips will be assembled, catalogued and uploaded as we progress and after the field work is completed. 

We will be providing camera equipment, tripods, cases, Adobe software, web structure and expertise.  But that will not be enough to complete this project.

We will need additional financial assistance for the following:

  • €7,000 for direct production expenses including insurance, travel, food and lodging.

  • €9,500 for additional equipment including an additional camera, sliders, laptop, software and website upgrade. You can find a list of the necessary equipment in our blog article:  What additional equipment is necessary?

The name of everyone who donates to the project will be named and thanked on our Donor’s Page.  In addition, we will provide a few other perks:

  • Smaller donations will receive prints.

  • Medium level donations will receive prints and discounted clips for promotional use. 

  • Large donations will receive free clips for promotional use. 

Risks and challenges

We have never done a project like this.  No one has, that is why we are doing it.  Large sweeping project have inherent risks and challenges.  Though risk can never fully be avoided, the effect can be somewhat mitigated through careful planning and an adherence to the general project principals. 

  • Equipment theft, damage or failure can be somewhat mitigated with appropriate insurance coverage.  This cost of this coverage is included in the direct production expenses and will be extended over the term of the project.

  • Illness, injury or death of the project principals.  Both principals will be covered by health and life insurance over the course of the project.  If one or both principals become temporarily unable to work on the project the term of the project will be extended.  If one of the principals is unable to continue then that person will be replaced.  If both are unable to continue the project will be cancelled, and no refund will be issued. 

  • Weather delays.  Most of this project will be shot outside and subject to prevailing weather conditions.  Part of our considerations for each region includes existing meteorological data.  Weather delays may occur and the result will be an extension of the project term. 

Other ways you can help.

We understand that money is tight and that there are many worthy projects that beg for assistance.  There are other things that can be done to help:

  • Please like and share our project so that we can reach others who might be interested.

  • Feedback on how to improve our proposal.

  • Recommendations of sites along the way.    

  • Recommendations for lodging.

  • Keep up to date with the project though our blog at www.waw-project.sleepinggiantstudio.ie/wordpress/

story:
LAZARUS TAXON, a journey into the tradional Maltese workshops


LAZARUS TAXON is a photo book that explores the traditional and forgotten workshops on the island of Malta in the heart of the Mediterranean sea.

What is a Lazarus Taxon? In paleontology, a Lazarus Taxon is a specie that disappears from the fossil record, only to reappear later. The great craftsmen we thought disappeared are rediscovered in this incredible journey.

     With Konrad Buhagiar we are teaming up for this beautiful project. Me, Arnaud Griggio, I'm a French photographer based in Malta for almost 6 years. I started taking pictures of the Maltese workshops 3 years ago and met more than a 100 workers of any kind. Konrad is an internationally acclaimed Maltese architect and the writer of the Lazarus Taxon's text in English and Maltese.

 In this book I want to reintroduce those Maltese characters who work in old “beautiful”, rusty, dusty and very graphic workshops. 


 When I arrived in Malta in 2010 I was immediately amazed by the beauty of the Maltese traditional workshops. I soon started to take them in pictures and had the idea to share those incredible venues in a book that would mix the aesthetics of the project with a more social dimension.

I went to discover a hundred of those hidden workshops in the last 3 years and took thousands of pictures. To share the peculiar graphic atmosphere that stands out of those venues is a real challenge.  

The organized chaos that inhabits those workshops is just sublime. It expresses a vision of history that slowly built itself by sedimentation, organizing layers of dust, textures, multiple materials to transform those working places in Aladdin's caves.

The evolution of the Maltese society is so fast that my photos already have historical value. Some of the workshops that I shot few years ago don't even exist any more. Inexorably the place given to those workshops is slowly and sadly disappearing. So with the team we feel that we have to publish a gorgeous book but also keep it affordable for everybody (less than 30€/35$), therefore we decided to ask for your full support via this Kickstarter campaign.

 I think that the new generations shouldn't forget about this part of their social history. Malta will never get back to what it used to be so this book keeps an open window on that time and preserve a spirit difficult to find today. That is exactly why I feel this splendid book should be published.

We decided to ask for people s support via our crowdfunding campaign as a high quality photo book is expensive to produce. We think that this work should be a great homage to all those workers that kept working decades out of the mainstream and also kept welcoming us warmly for years telling us so many stories. This book is to be printed as a a superb complete photo book. 

Its characteristics:

  • 178 pages 22 x 25 cm ( 8.6 x 9.8 inch ) 
  • Hardcover photo book with dust jacket 
  • 32 workshops, an introduction text and 15 pictures in 4 pages for each workshop, all printed on Mohawk Fine Papers. 
  • An introduction of 20 pages in English and 20 pages in Maltese is going to present the context and the social aspect and importance of the subject.

To launch the book, we will be organizing an exhibition of the 32 main pictures of the workshops in a beautiful venue in Malta.

PERKS:


We hope you, the Kickstarter community, will help support the first edition of Lazarus Taxon. The book has been edited, designed, and is in pre-press production. We’re on track to release it in winter 2016.

Creating an important and historical photography book in an edition of 1000 requires the technical, design, editing, writing, and printing talents of a team of dedicated professionals. If this campaign is successful, 100% of the proceeds from Kickstarter will be applied to the direct costs of producing what we expect will become a lasting contribution to the Maltese documentary field.

Your support will ensure that the book will be produced at the same level of excellence as the photographs originally captured. We strive to realize in book form the same exceptional, beautiful atmosphere seen in the workshops. You will find a complete, detailed description of our book on this Kickstarter page or on our website http://www.lazarustaxonbook.com/.

After making your pledge, please help us spread the word by contacting your friends about our Kickstarter campaign. 

Thank you!

story:
Open Mag Vol I 

 

Hi, my name is Alex, I'm a mexican photographer who believes in diversity of beauty. In the world we live we are constantly in front of parametters of how human beauty should be. I truly believe that beauty is much more than a list of stereotypes.

Everybody can enjoy their own beauty and sexuallity, and we all have the right to feel confortable in our own bodies.

DeProfundis MX exists to remind us that we all are equal and nobody is more important just for fitting in media beauty standars. It also teach us that aesthetic values can help people to experience situations and sensations through media such as photography, showing that anyone can their own body.

Erotism and self love is one of the most important parts of personal development and happiness.

-

Soy un fotógrafo mexicano que cree en la diversidad de la belleza, en un mundo en donde estamos constantemente bombardeados de parámetros del "deber ser" de la belleza humana. Creo que la belleza es mucho más que una lista de estereotipos.

Todos podemos disfrutar nuestra belleza y sexualidad, y todos tenemos el derecho de sentirnos bien con nuestros propios cuerpos. 

DeProfundis MX existe para recordarnos que todos somos iguales y nadie es más importante por encajar en los estándares de belleza difundidos a través de los medios. Los valores estéticos pueden ayudar a la gente a experimentar situaciones y sensaciones a través de medios como la fotografía, enseñándonos que cualquiera puede disfrutar de su propio cuerpo.

El erotismo y el auto-cuidado de nuestras emociones respecto a lo que somos es una de las partes más importantes del desarrollo personal y nuestra propia felicidad.

 

What we offer / Qué ofrecemos

 

We are a team working with homoerotic beauty diversity represented through photo and video. DeProfundis wants to make an art mag  with 100 homoerotic photos. 

We need 5000 USD for the photography work, models, editorial design and impresion of 500 copies.

- 

Somos un equipo trabajando con la diversidad de bellezas dentro del homoerotismo, y lo representamos a través de fotos y videos. DePRofundis quiere hacer una revista de arte con más de 100 fotografías.

Necesitamos 5000 dólares para el trabajo fotográfico, modelos, diseño editorial y la impresión de 500 copias. 

 

 

We believe than representation matters, and an homoerotic aesthetic with diversity of bodies can encourage people to feel comfortable with their own sexuality. It is not true that we all need to look the same to feel beautiful!

story:
Short Summary

I am a professional photographer/videographer and a seven year Stage 4 tonsil cancer survivor. HNC is most often diagnosed at Stage 4. We all know the later the stage of disease at diagnosis the more rigorous and harsh the treatment. I'm ecstatic the treatment to eradicate the cancer did it's job but the lasting effects on my breathing, speaking and eating abilities since treatment are significant. I am not alone in these tremendous quality of life issues after head and neck cancer (aka HNC) treatment. HNC people often feel uncomfortable in social situations because of these effects.  And people out and about do not know about or understand the challenges.  These factors can lead to a life of isolation after treatment for the HNC person and their loved ones.

The incidence of HNC is about 3 - 5% of all cancer cases being diagnosed in the USA today. HNC does not receive 3 - 5% of allocated research dollars. Private donations are rarely made. Due to lack of awareness and lack of research funding facilities are struggling to attract talented physicians and PhDs to concentrate on developing prevention, earlier diagnosis and kinder yet still effective treatments. Until the need to develop these there will be no change for people yet to be diagnosed.  Due to HPV the incidence of HNC is on the rise in younger people, men and women. 

My campaign is to produce a large, glossy photo coffee table book featuring stunning landscape photography from across our beautiful country and to highlight HNC people in those locations.  They will tell in their own words the effect HNC has had on their lives and those around them and how they are faring after treatment.  I see the book as a perfect accompaniment to medical facilities where people are going to receive potentially devastating news, are in treatment or recovery and would appreciate hope and education about HNC.  It will also be purchased by people who appreciate fine landscape photography as an adornment to their home or office.  It will be a gift that gives in many ways.  Proceeds from the sale of the book will go directly to head and neck cancer research.


What We Need & What You Get

Funding for this project will go toward travel and lodging to each state of our beautiful country and spending time with HNC people in those areas. Funding will also go toward producing the hard cover photo book.

Funds raised and not spent in producing the photobook will be donated directly to head and neck cancer research.

Everyone donating will receive photography captured during the project. The "perks" will be outlined but I wanted to let you know that everyone will get something!


The Impact

Your involvement in this project will raise awareness and directly drive funding toward head and neck cancer research. Let's be as dedicated about saving the breathing tubes and the swallowing tubes as we are about saving other body parts that are affected by cancer. Let's be voice that speaks for voices lost.  Together we can the ones who drive the change in treatment so yet to be diagnosed HNC people will continue to enjoy their quality of life and social contributions after diagnosis and treatment.


Other Ways You Can Help

I will be needing people to help with introduction to HNC people in areas I have no connections as yet.  I will need people who will be willing to host get togethers or even offer a warm meal, a hot shower, a comfy bed or use of their washer/dryer!  There are so many ways you can help.  Please, get involved.

story:
Origins of the Sweet Dreams Photo-Book Project

Hello to everyone.

My name is Zaida and I am starting my career as a model. As you may already know, all the beginnings are hard and complicated.

I have already done a few photographic sessions and performances, now I want to create a Photo-Book and spread it all over the world and let people know about me.

Of course, that would cost a lot of money which I currently don't have, so a friend recommended me to start a Indiegogo campaing to try to get the funds for the project.

We discussed a lot about the thematic of the Photo-Book, size and characteristics, and that’s how the title and the contents came to us.

As this job is like a dream becoming reality, we found that "Sweet Dreams" will be an appropriate name.

So that, once we had the name, thinking the thematic was easier than we thought at first.

That’s how we decided that it will be a lingerie and bed thematic. We think that we will get great results with that thematic and people will enjoy it.

The images that you see here, even they are mine, are not the ones that will be in the Photo-Book. A new photographic sesion will be made from which all the photographs will be taken.

 

The Photo-Book

Sweet Dreams will be a 25x25cm 58 pages full color Photo-Book when it’s completed, but this will only happen with your support!

The book will be a Limited Edition of 1.000 units and each copy will be dated, numbered and personally signed by me.

Given the large dimensions, volume and print quality requirements, this type of a photo book is fairly expensive to print.

The Indiegogo goal will only cover the first 200 units, including the photographic session, printing and taxes. If this Indiegogo campaign raises funds beyond that, the amount of copies will be increased accordingly, until the Limited Edition run of 1.000 copies is reached, which will cost around 35.000 €

Rewards

As a way to thank you for your help to make this campaing sucessfull, here are the rewards depending on how much money you invest in the project:

Please, keep in mind that, with the exception of the 5 € perk, shipping is not included in the perks with need items to be shipped to your home.

Also, custom duties may be charged to you in your country.

  • 2 €: This will grant you a computer wallpaper with one of the photographs that will be inside of the book.

  • 5 €: A postcard with a image different from the one in the wallpaper will be sent to you anywhere in the world. No aditional costs for the shipping are needed.

  • 25 €: Digital copy of the Photo-Book.

  • 30 €: Digital copy of the Photo-Book + computer wallpaper + postcard.

  • 50 €: One copy of the printed Photo-Book, with a size of 25x25cm. Limited Edition, numbered, dated and signed.

  • 75 €: Copy of the printed Photo-Book plus the digital copy, the computer wallpaper and the postcard.

  • 200 €: Two copies of the Limited Edition Photo-Book, the digital copy, the computer wallpaper, the postcard, and an aditional postcard and another computer wallpaper with exclusive images wich will not be in the book.
    Also, your name will be in the "Thank You" page of the book.

  • 500 €: Premium Edition of the Photo-Book. This Premium Edition version will be in a 35x35cm. size and will have 12 aditional pages with photographs that will not be in the Limited Edition 25x25cm version. These books will only be printed to cover the rewards and up to a maximum of 25 units. This is a way to specially thank you for your high support.
    Your name will be too in the "Thank You" page of both versions of the book.

  • 750 €: Premium Edition of the Photo-Book as the one in the 500 € perk.
    With this perk you will also be granted with two copies of the Limited Edition Photo-Book in its standard 25x25cm version, the digital copy, the two computer wallpapers and the two postcards.
    Your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the books.
    Also you will get an exclusive 40x30cm Photo Print which will not be neither the Premium Edition nor the Limited Edition book.

  • 1.500 €: You will get the same rewards as the 750$ perk plus a exclusive DVD video with the “Making Off” of the photographic session.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this project please share it with your friends, Facebook, Blogs, Websites and any other place where you can say a word about it would be great.

Also, all sugestions and ideas are welcome, I'll try my best to answer your questions and to improve the campaing.

I will keep this site updated with all the new relevant info.

Best regards and thanks for your support.

story:
Calendar

      I believe we can find a way to make a difference in the world through our creativity and skills. Calendar helps to raise funds for New York City, The Mayor's Fund.

Calendar from July 2020 to December 2021, features snapshots planned and produced in conjunction with a friend of mine, a world-class photographer. The images in this calendar are warm, friendly and welcoming. Lasting a full eighteen months, this calendar is available in a wall and a table version.

 

Make your contribution, claim your calendar and show your support
for the COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund!

18 month calendar (July 2020 to December 2021)

Table calendar 4 x 8 in size (10 x 20 cm)

Wall calendar (open)  16 x 10in size (40 x 26 cm)

USA format  Week starts Sunday.
 

 

     Making It Happen

I will donate all of the profit to COVID-19 Emergency Relief fund:

  • support health care workers,
  • displaced hourly workers,
  • families, youth,
  • vulnerable New Yorkers experiencing the unprecedented impacts of COVID-19.
     

 

Risks & Challenges

        The calendar already created , there is no major risk to what comes next. Pledge to keep all contributors updated throughout the printing and distribution processes. 
Calendars expecting to deliver July 2020.
 

     Tell a Friend!

         Please share a link to this campaign with your friends and family. We are all in this fight together. I appreciate your support.


 

 

 

 

 

 

2020

 

2021

 

or donate direct to:

https://www1.nyc.gov/site/fund/initiatives/covid-19-emergency-relief-fund.page

Thank you.
 

think Photos - think Photube

story:
About me
Hi! I'm Orestis and I'm an amateur photographer from Greece. I took up photography in 2004 the year I also took up lessons at a local (municipal) two year photography class. Since then photography has become a great passion for me and I always try to become better, while maintaining a more "traditional" approach to the medium, even after I gave up my analog camera for digital during summer of 2009.

About the project
So three years ago a project started without any intention to do so…
I just realised it a few months ago while looking all the pictures I had taken with my three year old, soon to be replaced, phone. Then I went on to check all the photos I had taken over the last three years with my dslr camera which i had bought almost at the same time with that phone. What I saw was all my street photography photos taken in these three years from two different perspectives and how that affected the overall appearance of the two group's photos.
Photos, which until then I just saw individually, took a whole new meaning and the David and Goliath photobook idea was born.
I'm not a pro, I do what I do just because I love it and this is my first attempt to go public after 9 years of photography. I gathered what I considered the best photos of both David and Goliath which led me to 52 photos from both groups (26 from each), I planed the photobook and worked with friends to prepare it. The photos cover a wide range from buildings, to public transportation and people, all street photography aspects I like to shoot, and where taken while commuting, during long walks or just site seeing. All photographs are in black and white and with minimum editing, mainly cropping and exposure adjusting and Davids photos were exclusively edited on the cell phone it self, so you see there is no cheating for the little guy.



About the goal of the project
I start with no budget, I tried my best to keep the cost at minimum and I just want to be able to share my work, so help me reach it so I can print at such low cost and share my work with you and friends.
What I need to print for such a low price as 15€ is to reach a minimum goal of 2200€, so help me go for it!

Last but not least
While the 2200€ are just enough to cover the expenses of 50 plain, 30 hard cover  photobooks and the prints (including packaging and mailing expenses), if things go even better and I exceed my goal, I plan to use what extra money comes from this project to buy a second lens for Goliath (David was recently upgraded to a 5MP camera :-)

The perks:
1. A downloadable version of the book which will be distributed via a download link shortly after the last book has been shipped.
2. A set of two prints, a david and a goliath one of your choice, printed and shipped after the downloadable book is distributed, so everybody can make their selection.
3. A paperback copy of the book.
4. A hard-cover, higher quality print of the book.

The photobook comes in either English or Greek version.


 
Special Thanks
To Mariam from urchin.gr for the book editing and graphic design, Anna for the text editing and patience, Lewis West and Thomas Tellefsen for their generous offer of "Shangri La" track for the promo video, and all my friends for their support.

story:
Owl Eye Photos 

...is true photography that represents art, life and family in real, bold light and color. It starts with us - wife & husband team, Leah & Ryan Stohs. We met in 1995 in drum corps and have now been married almost 19 years; over a dozen of those years have been spent living in San Jose, CA  while raising our two children: Anna, 11 - kind, loving, funny, an accomplished artist, and budding violist; and Riley, 8 - energetic, joyful, crafty little smarty pants who is on the autism spectrum - always keeping us on our toes while simultaneously keeping us grounded. 

We have always believed in the importance of the arts and art education and have dedicated our lives to supporting our family using our talents and passion working as professional musicians, photographers, artists, teachers (+ any other ways to make ends meet!)... I (Leah) have been passionate about photography my entire life, working photo jobs on the side for many years. I have recently chosen to pursue a photography career full time, with Ryan's unconditional support and additional artistic eye, as he continues his career as a full time musician, teacher and writer. 

We offer photography services in the San Jose/Santa Cruz/SF Bay Area (and beyond) as Owl Eye Photos - www.owleyephotos.com - and have been very blessed to meet and photograph some amazing clients so far, as well as work with local nonprofits and charities on various things, including a current project addressing homelessness in the area. Still, the hustle required as creatives attempting to thrive in the heart of the Silicon Valley is very real, so we are learning to work smarter every day and think outside the box to extend our reach as far as it can go. Part of our hustle is now expanding into creating this first Indiegogo campaign.

Our goal with Indiegogo is to first use it as a platform to showcase some of our favorite original photography work in limited-run prints, and to include (discounted!) specials for our photo services to help share our art, fund our business, and support our family. For this first campaign we are featuring a 13"x 19" signed, limited-run print of a breathtaking sunset that was captured by me (Leah) using a Pentax K3ii on a warm December day at Lighthouse Beach in Santa Cruz, CA. I had just shot a family photo session and chose to stick around afterwards for an additional session with the sun and surf, resulting in this unforgettable moment. 

This stunning print is perfect for the freezing winter to warm up any wall it graces... or as a thoughtful gift for anyone (including yourself) that says - "Hey! You survived today. Now, here's something pretty."

For $25 you will receive:

  • One 13"x 19" signed limited-run print of "Winter Sunset" shipped by Monday, 2/28/18.

For $125 you will receive:

  •  One 13"x 19" signed limited-run print of "Winter Sunset" shipped by Monday, 2/28/18.
  • An Owl Eye Photos 30-minute Portrait Session (for you or as a gift):
    • 1-4 people
    • 6+ digital images
    • + one 8"x 10" print of your favorite photo from the session
    • in the San Jose/Santa Cruz/San Francisco Bay Area only
    • scheduled by December 31st, 2018. 

    Our primary goal with this campaign is to print the limited run of 20 signed 13"x 19" copies of "Winter Sunset" for $25 each to raise a minimum of $500.

    Our secondary goal is offering 4 Special Packages including a signed 13"x 19" copy of "Winter Sunset" PLUS an Owl Eye Photos Portrait Session for $125 in efforts to raise an additional $500.

    These funds will be used to cover the costs of printing and shipping, to help with some very necessary car repairs for our shared vehicle so we can keep on truckin', and anything left will be used for basic business and family expenses to keep our artistic endeavors going to the next campaign!

    If you don't have any space on your wall for this gorgeous print, but would still like to help us out, please share this campaign with anyone you know who may be interested!

    Many thanks!

    Owl Eye Photos/The Stohs Family

I had just shot a family photo session and chose to stick around afterwards for an additional session with the sun and surf, resulting in this unforgettable moment. This stunning print is perfect for the freezing winter to warm up any wall it graces... or as a thoughtful gift for anyone (including yourself) that says - "Hey! You survived today. Now, here's something pretty."For $25 you will receive:One 13"x 19" signed limited-run print of "Winter Sunset" shipped by Monday, 2/28/18.For $125 you will receive:
 One 13"x 19" signed limited-run print of "Winter Sunset" shipped by Monday, 2/28/18.

Our primary goal with this campaign is to print the limited run of 20 signed 13"x 19" copies of "Winter Sunset" for $25 each to raise a minimum of $500.Our secondary goal is offering 4 Special Packages including a signed 13"x 19" copy of "Winter Sunset" PLUS an Owl Eye Photos Portrait Session for $125 in efforts to raise an additional $500.These funds will be used to cover the costs of printing and shipping, to help with some very necessary car repairs for our shared vehicle so we can keep on truckin', and anything left will be used for basic business and family expenses to keep our artistic endeavors going to the next campaign!If you don't have any space on your wall for this gorgeous print, but would still like to help us out, please share this campaign with anyone you know who may be interested!Many thanks!Owl Eye Photos/The Stohs Family
